First, note that there are total of (αb​T2​c)\binom{\alpha_{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}b}T}{2c}( FRACOP start_ARG italic_α start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_c end_ARG ) partitions satisfying (C1) and (C3) by moving 2​c2c2 italic_c trajectories from 𝒞b(0){\mathcal{C}}_{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}b}^{(0)}caligraphic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to 𝒞a(m){\mathcal{C}}_{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a}^{(m)}caligraphic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. For each such partition, there are at most ∑ℓ=0c(2​cℓ)​(αb​T−2​cℓ)\sum_{\ell=0}^{c}\binom{2c}{\ell}\binom{\alpha_{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}b}T-2c}{\ell}∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( FRACOP start_ARG 2 italic_c end_ARG start_ARG roman_ℓ end_ARG ) ( FRACOP start_ARG italic_α start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T - 2 italic_c end_ARG start_ARG roman_ℓ end_ARG ) partitions that still satisfy (C1) and (C3) but violate (C2), as such partitions must be created via swapping ℓ\ellroman_ℓ elements from 𝒞b(m){\mathcal{C}}_{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}b}^{(m)}caligraphic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and ℓ\ellroman_ℓ elements from 𝒞a(m)∖𝒞a(0){\mathcal{C}}_{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a}^{(m)}\setminus{\mathcal{C}}_{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a}^{(0)}caligraphic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∖ caligraphic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT with ℓ≤c\ell\leq croman_ℓ ≤ italic_c. Thus, we have that

MT≥(αb​T2​c)∑ℓ=0c(2​cℓ)​(αb​T−2​cℓ)​≥(∗)​(αb​T2​c)2​c22​c−1​(e​αb​Tc)c=2​(αb​T16​e​c)c,M_{T}\geq\frac{\binom{\alpha_{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}b}T}{2c}}{\sum_{\ell=0}^{c}\binom{2c}{\ell}\binom{\alpha_{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}b}T-2c}{\ell}}\overset{(*)}{\geq}\frac{\left(\frac{\alpha_{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}b}T}{2c}\right)^{2c}}{2^{2c-1}\left(\frac{e\alpha_{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}b}T}{c}\right)^{c}}=2\left(\frac{\alpha_{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}b}T}{16ec}\right)^{c},italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≥ divide start_ARG ( FRACOP start_ARG italic_α start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_c end_ARG ) end_ARG start_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( FRACOP start_ARG 2 italic_c end_ARG start_ARG roman_ℓ end_ARG ) ( FRACOP start_ARG italic_α start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T - 2 italic_c end_ARG start_ARG roman_ℓ end_ARG ) end_ARG start_OVERACCENT ( ∗ ) end_OVERACCENT start_ARG ≥ end_ARG divide start_ARG ( divide start_ARG italic_α start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_c end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 italic_c end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 italic_c - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG italic_e italic_α start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_ARG start_ARG italic_c end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG = 2 ( divide start_ARG italic_α start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_ARG start_ARG 16 italic_e italic_c end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ,

where at (∗)(*)( ∗ ), we use the elementary inequalities (nm)m≤(nm)≤(e​nm)m\left(\frac{n}{m}\right)^{m}\leq\binom{n}{m}\leq\left(\frac{en}{m}\right)^{m}( divide start_ARG italic_n end_ARG start_ARG italic_m end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ ( FRACOP start_ARG italic_n end_ARG start_ARG italic_m end_ARG ) ≤ ( divide start_ARG italic_e italic_n end_ARG start_ARG italic_m end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT for n≥m≥1n\geq m\geq 1italic_n ≥ italic_m ≥ 1. ∎

Then, for a clustering algorithm 𝒜{\mathcal{A}}caligraphic_A that outputs a f^𝒜:[T]→[K]\widehat{f}_{\mathcal{A}}\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}[T]\rightarrow[K]over^ start_ARG italic_f end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : [ italic_T ] → [ italic_K ], consider the following hypothesis testing procedure:

Ra​(𝒜)=arg​minm∈{0}∪[MT]⁡minσ∈Sym​(K)⁡|𝒞a(m)​△​f^𝒜−1​(σ​(a))|,R_{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a}({\mathcal{A}})=\operatorname*{arg\,min}_{m\in\{0\}\cup[M_{T}]}\min_{\sigma\in\mathrm{Sym}(K)}\left|{\mathcal{C}}_{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a}^{(m)}\triangle\widehat{f}_{\mathcal{A}}^{-1}(\sigma({\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a}))\right|,italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_A ) = start_OPERATOR roman_arg roman_min end_OPERATOR start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ∈ { 0 } ∪ [ italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ∈ roman_Sym ( italic_K ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT △ over^ start_ARG italic_f end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_σ ( italic_a ) ) | , (13)

where for two sets A,BA,Bitalic_A , italic_B, A△B:=(A∖B)∪(B∖A)A\triangle B\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=(A\setminus B)\cup(B\setminus A)italic_A △ italic_B : = ( italic_A ∖ italic_B ) ∪ ( italic_B ∖ italic_A ) is their symmetric difference.

Intuitively, RaR_{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a}italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT outputs the most likely hypothesis out of {0}∪[MT]\{0\}\cup[M_{T}]{ 0 } ∪ [ italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ], given some estimated cluster for a{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a}italic_a. Let ℰ(m):={Ra(𝒜)=m}{\mathcal{E}}^{(m)}\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=\{R_{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a}({\mathcal{A}})=m\}caligraphic_E start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT : = { italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_A ) = italic_m } be disjoint events across m∈{0}∪[MT]m\in\{0\}\cup[M_{T}]italic_m ∈ { 0 } ∪ [ italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. Note that for each hypothesis m∈[MT]m\in[M_{T}]italic_m ∈ [ italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ], the corresponding 𝜶(m):=𝜶(f(m))\bm{\alpha}^{(m)}\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=\bm{\alpha}(f^{(m)})bold_italic_α start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT : = bold_italic_α ( italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) satisfies ∥𝜶−𝜶(m)∥2=2​2​cT=2​2​ε≤β\lVert\bm{\alpha}-\bm{\alpha}^{(m)}\rVert_{2}=\frac{2\sqrt{2}c}{T}=2\sqrt{2}\varepsilon\leq\beta∥ bold_italic_α - bold_italic_α start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG 2 square-root start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_c end_ARG start_ARG italic_T end_ARG = 2 square-root start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_ε ≤ italic_β. As 𝒜{\mathcal{A}}caligraphic_A is (ε,β,δ)(\varepsilon,\beta,\delta)( italic_ε , italic_β , italic_δ )-locally stable and any Type I/II error w.r.t. each model Ψn(m)\Psi_{n}^{(m)}roman_Ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT results in at least s+1s+1italic_s + 1 misclassifications (see condition (C2)), we must have that

min⁡{ℙ0​(ℰ(0)),minm∈[MT]⁡ℙm​(ℰ(m))}≥1−δ.\min\left\{{\mathbb{P}}_{0}\left({\mathcal{E}}^{(0)}\right),\ \min_{m\in[M_{T}]}{\mathbb{P}}_{m}\left({\mathcal{E}}^{(m)}\right)\right\}\geq 1-\delta.roman_min { blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_E start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) , roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ∈ [ italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_E start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) } ≥ 1 - italic_δ . (14)

Furthermore, we note that

ℙ0​(⋃m∈[MT]ℰ(m))≤δ,{\mathbb{P}}_{0}\left(\bigcup_{m\in[M_{T}]}{\mathcal{E}}^{(m)}\right)\leq\delta,blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ∈ [ italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_E start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ≤ italic_δ , (15)

as if ℰ(m){\mathcal{E}}^{(m)}caligraphic_E start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is true for some m∈[MT]m\in[M_{T}]italic_m ∈ [ italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ], then

2​c<ET​(f,f(m))≤ET​(f^𝒜,f)+ET​(f^𝒜,f(m))≤ET​(f^𝒜,f)+c⟹ET​(f^𝒜,f)>c,2c<E_{T}(f,f^{(m)})\leq E_{T}(\widehat{f}_{\mathcal{A}},f)+E_{T}(\widehat{f}_{\mathcal{A}},f^{(m)})\leq E_{T}(\widehat{f}_{\mathcal{A}},f)+c\Longrightarrow E_{T}(\widehat{f}_{\mathcal{A}},f)>c,2 italic_c < italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_f , italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ≤ italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_f end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_f ) + italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_f end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ≤ italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_f end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_f ) + italic_c ⟹ italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_f end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_f ) > italic_c ,

which holds with probability at most δ\deltaitalic_δ due to 𝒜{\mathcal{A}}caligraphic_A being (ε,β,δ)(\varepsilon,\beta,\delta)( italic_ε , italic_β , italic_δ )-stable. Note that due to the disjointness of ℰ(m){\mathcal{E}}^{(m)}caligraphic_E start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT’s, we additionally have that

1MT​∑m∈[MT]ℙ0​(ℰ(m))≤δ⟹minm∈[MT]⁡ℙ0​(ℰ(m))≤δMT.\frac{1}{M_{T}}\sum_{m\in[M_{T}]}{\mathbb{P}}_{0}\left({\mathcal{E}}^{(m)}\right)\leq\delta\Longrightarrow\min_{m\in[M_{T}]}{\mathbb{P}}_{0}\left({\mathcal{E}}^{(m)}\right)\leq\frac{\delta}{M_{T}}.divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ∈ [ italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_E start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ≤ italic_δ ⟹ roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ∈ [ italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_E start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ≤ divide start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG start_ARG italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG . (16)

We now define the log-likelihood ratio of the given trajectories {𝒯t=(st,1,⋯,st,H)}t∈[T]\left\{{\mathcal{T}}_{t}=(s_{t,1},\cdots,s_{t,H})\right\}_{t\in[T]}{ caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t ∈ [ italic_T ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT under the true model (m=0m=0italic_m = 0) and the mmitalic_m-th alternate model:

𝒬T(m):=logℙm​({𝒯t}t∈[T])ℙ0​({𝒯t}t∈[T])=∑t∈𝒞a(m)∖𝒞a(0)logℙ(a)​(st,1,⋯,st,H)ℙ(b)​(st,1,⋯,st,H).{\mathcal{Q}}_{T}^{(m)}\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=\log\frac{{\mathbb{P}}_{m}(\{{\mathcal{T}}_{t}\}_{t\in[T]})}{{\mathbb{P}}_{0}(\{{\mathcal{T}}_{t}\}_{t\in[T]})}=\sum_{t\in{\mathcal{C}}_{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a}^{(m)}\setminus{\mathcal{C}}_{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a}^{(0)}}\log\frac{{\mathbb{P}}^{({\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a})}(s_{t,1},\cdots,s_{t,H})}{{\mathbb{P}}^{({\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}b})}(s_{t,1},\cdots,s_{t,H})}.caligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT : = roman_log divide start_ARG blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( { caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t ∈ [ italic_T ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( { caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t ∈ [ italic_T ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t ∈ caligraphic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∖ caligraphic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log divide start_ARG blackboard_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_a ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG blackboard_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_b ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG . (17)

Taking the expectation w.r.t. the mmitalic_m-th alternate model, we have

𝔼m​[𝒬T(m)]\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{m}\left[{\mathcal{Q}}_{T}^{(m)}\right]blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ caligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] =∑t∈𝒞a(m)∖𝒞a(0)𝔼m​[log⁡ℙ(a)​(st,1,⋯,st,H)ℙ(b)​(st,1,⋯,st,H)]\displaystyle=\sum_{t\in{\mathcal{C}}_{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a}^{(m)}\setminus{\mathcal{C}}_{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a}^{(0)}}\mathbb{E}_{m}\left[\log\frac{{\mathbb{P}}^{({\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a})}(s_{t,1},\cdots,s_{t,H})}{{\mathbb{P}}^{({\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}b})}(s_{t,1},\cdots,s_{t,H})}\right]= ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t ∈ caligraphic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∖ caligraphic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log divide start_ARG blackboard_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_a ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG blackboard_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_b ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG ]
=∑t∈𝒞a(m)∖𝒞a(0)𝔼m​[log⁡μ(a)​(st,1)μ(b)​(st,1)+∑h=1H−1log⁡p(a)​(st,h+1|st,h)p(b)​(st,h+1|st,h)]\displaystyle=\sum_{t\in{\mathcal{C}}_{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a}^{(m)}\setminus{\mathcal{C}}_{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a}^{(0)}}\mathbb{E}_{m}\left[\log\frac{\mu^{({\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a})}(s_{t,1})}{\mu^{({\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}b})}(s_{t,1})}+\sum_{h=1}^{H-1}\log\frac{p^{({\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a})}(s_{t,h+1}|s_{t,h})}{p^{({\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}b})}(s_{t,h+1}|s_{t,h})}\right]= ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t ∈ caligraphic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∖ caligraphic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log divide start_ARG italic_μ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_a ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_μ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_b ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG + ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_a ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_b ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG ]
=2c[𝖪𝖫(μ(a),μ(b))+∑h=1H−1∑s∈𝒮ℙ(a)(st,h=s)𝖪𝖫(p(a)(⋅|s),p(b)(⋅|s))]\displaystyle=2c\left[\operatorname{{\mathsf{KL}}}\left(\mu^{({\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a})},\mu^{({\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}b})}\right)+\sum_{h=1}^{H-1}\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}}{\mathbb{P}}^{({\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a})}(s_{t,h}=s)\operatorname{{\mathsf{KL}}}\left(p^{({\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a})}(\cdot|s),p^{({\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}b})}(\cdot|s)\right)\right]= 2 italic_c [ sansserif_KL ( italic_μ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_a ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_μ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_b ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∈ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_a ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_s ) sansserif_KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_a ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ⋅ | italic_s ) , italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_b ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ⋅ | italic_s ) ) ] (Law of total expectation w.r.t. st,hs_{t,h}italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT)
=2​(H−1)​c​[1H−1𝖪𝖫(μ(a),μ(b))+∑s∈𝒮ℙH(a)(s)𝖪𝖫(p(a)(⋅|s),p(b)(⋅|s))]⏟=⁣:𝒟(a,b).\displaystyle=2(H-1)c\underbrace{\left[\frac{1}{H-1}\operatorname{{\mathsf{KL}}}\left(\mu^{({\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a})},\mu^{({\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}b})}\right)+\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}}{\mathbb{P}}_{H}^{({\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a})}(s)\operatorname{{\mathsf{KL}}}\left(p^{({\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a})}(\cdot|s),p^{({\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}b})}(\cdot|s)\right)\right]}_{=\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}{\mathcal{D}}^{({\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a},{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}b})}}.= 2 ( italic_H - 1 ) italic_c under⏟ start_ARG [ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_H - 1 end_ARG sansserif_KL ( italic_μ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_a ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_μ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_b ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∈ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_a ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) sansserif_KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_a ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ⋅ | italic_s ) , italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_b ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ⋅ | italic_s ) ) ] end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT = : caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_a , italic_b ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (ℙH(a)(s):=1H−1∑h=1H−1ℙ(a)(st,h=s){\mathbb{P}}_{H}^{({\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a})}(s)\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=\frac{1}{H-1}\sum_{h=1}^{H-1}{\mathbb{P}}^{({\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a})}(s_{t,h}=s)blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_a ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) : = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_H - 1 end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_a ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_s ))

There are two paths from here, one inspired by the arguments of Jedra and Proutière [2023] that utilizes data processing inequality, and another inspired by Yun and Proutière [2019] that utilizes Markov’s inequality. The former leads to the non-asymptotic guarantee, while the latter leads to the asymptotic guarantee.

Non-asymptotic guarantee. We recall the likelihood version of the data processing inequality777This has been referred to as the “Fundamental Inequality” in Garivier et al. [2019], as using this allows for a strikingly simple proof of distribution-dependent bandit regret lower bounds.:

Lemma A.2 (Data Processing Inequality; Lemma 1 of Garivier et al. [2019]).

Consider a measurable space (Γ,𝒢)(\Gamma,{\mathcal{G}})( roman_Γ , caligraphic_G ) equipped with two probability measure ℙ1{\mathbb{P}}_{1}blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and ℙ2{\mathbb{P}}_{2}blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Then, we have that

𝖪𝖫⁡(ℙ1,ℙ2)≥supZ𝗄𝗅​(𝔼1​[Z],𝔼2​[Z]),\operatorname{{\mathsf{KL}}}({\mathbb{P}}_{1},{\mathbb{P}}_{2})\geq\sup_{Z}{\mathsf{kl}}(\mathbb{E}_{1}[Z],\mathbb{E}_{2}[Z]),sansserif_KL ( blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≥ roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT sansserif_kl ( blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_Z ] , blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_Z ] ) , (18)

where supZ\sup_{Z}roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is over all possible 𝒢{\mathcal{G}}caligraphic_G-measurable random variable Z:Ω→[0,1]Z\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}\Omega\rightarrow[0,1]italic_Z : roman_Ω → [ 0 , 1 ] and 𝗄𝗅{\mathsf{kl}}sansserif_kl is the Bernoulli KL divergence, i.e., 𝗄𝗅(p,q):=plogpq+(1−p)log1−p1−q{\mathsf{kl}}(p,q)\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=p\log\frac{p}{q}+(1-p)\log\frac{1-p}{1-q}sansserif_kl ( italic_p , italic_q ) : = italic_p roman_log divide start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_ARG italic_q end_ARG + ( 1 - italic_p ) roman_log divide start_ARG 1 - italic_p end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_q end_ARG for p,q∈(0,1)p,q\in(0,1)italic_p , italic_q ∈ ( 0 , 1 ).

In the above lemma, let (Γ,𝒢)(\Gamma,{\mathcal{G}})( roman_Γ , caligraphic_G ) be our observation space of TTitalic_T trajectories, ℙ1=ℙm{\mathbb{P}}_{1}={\mathbb{P}}_{m}blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, ℙ2=ℙ0{\mathbb{P}}_{2}={\mathbb{P}}_{0}blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and Z=𝟙​{ℰ(m)}Z=\mathds{1}\{{\mathcal{E}}^{(m)}\}italic_Z = blackboard_1 { caligraphic_E start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT }.

Then, we have that

2​(H−1)​c​𝒟(a,b)\displaystyle 2(H-1)c{\mathcal{D}}^{({\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a},{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}b})}2 ( italic_H - 1 ) italic_c caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_a , italic_b ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT =1MT​∑m∈[MT]𝖪𝖫⁡(ℙm,ℙ0)\displaystyle=\frac{1}{M_{T}}\sum_{m\in[M_{T}]}\operatorname{{\mathsf{KL}}}\left({\mathbb{P}}_{m},{\mathbb{P}}_{0}\right)= divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ∈ [ italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT sansserif_KL ( blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )
≥1MT​∑m∈[MT]𝗄𝗅​(ℙm​(ℰ(m)),ℙ0​(ℰ(m)))\displaystyle\geq\frac{1}{M_{T}}\sum_{m\in[M_{T}]}{\mathsf{kl}}\left({\mathbb{P}}_{m}({\mathcal{E}}^{(m)}),{\mathbb{P}}_{0}({\mathcal{E}}^{(m)})\right)≥ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ∈ [ italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT sansserif_kl ( blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_E start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) , blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_E start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) (Lemma A.2)
≥𝗄𝗅​(1MT​∑m∈[MT]ℙm​(ℰ(m)),1MT​∑m∈[MT]ℙ0​(ℰ(m)))\displaystyle\geq{\mathsf{kl}}\left(\frac{1}{M_{T}}\sum_{m\in[M_{T}]}{\mathbb{P}}_{m}({\mathcal{E}}^{(m)}),\frac{1}{M_{T}}\sum_{m\in[M_{T}]}{\mathbb{P}}_{0}\left({\mathcal{E}}^{(m)}\right)\right)≥ sansserif_kl ( divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ∈ [ italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_E start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ∈ [ italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_E start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) (joint convexity of 𝗄𝗅{\mathsf{kl}}sansserif_kl)
=𝗄𝗅​(1MT​∑m∈[MT]ℙm​(ℰ(m)),1MT​ℙ0​(⋃m∈[MT]ℰ(m)))\displaystyle={\mathsf{kl}}\left(\frac{1}{M_{T}}\sum_{m\in[M_{T}]}{\mathbb{P}}_{m}({\mathcal{E}}^{(m)}),\frac{1}{M_{T}}{\mathbb{P}}_{0}\left(\bigcup_{m\in[M_{T}]}{\mathcal{E}}^{(m)}\right)\right)= sansserif_kl ( divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ∈ [ italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_E start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ∈ [ italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_E start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) (ℰ(m){\mathcal{E}}^{(m)}caligraphic_E start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT’s are disjoint)
≥(∗)​𝗄𝗅​(1−δ,δMT)\displaystyle\overset{(*)}{\geq}{\mathsf{kl}}\left(1-\delta,\frac{\delta}{M_{T}}\right)start_OVERACCENT ( ∗ ) end_OVERACCENT start_ARG ≥ end_ARG sansserif_kl ( 1 - italic_δ , divide start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG start_ARG italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG )
≥(∗∗)​(1−δ)​log⁡MTδ−log⁡2\displaystyle\overset{(**)}{\geq}(1-\delta)\log\frac{M_{T}}{\delta}-\log 2start_OVERACCENT ( ∗ ∗ ) end_OVERACCENT start_ARG ≥ end_ARG ( 1 - italic_δ ) roman_log divide start_ARG italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG - roman_log 2
≥12​log⁡1δ+c2​log⁡αb​T16​e​c−12​log⁡2\displaystyle\geq\frac{1}{2}\log\frac{1}{\delta}+\frac{c}{2}\log\frac{\alpha_{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}b}T}{16ec}-\frac{1}{2}\log 2≥ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG + divide start_ARG italic_c end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_α start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_ARG start_ARG 16 italic_e italic_c end_ARG - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG roman_log 2 (Lemma A.1, δ∈(0,1/2]\delta\in(0,1/2]italic_δ ∈ ( 0 , 1 / 2 ])
≥12​log⁡12​δ+c2​log⁡αmin​T16​e​c.\displaystyle\geq\frac{1}{2}\log\frac{1}{2\delta}+\frac{c}{2}\log\frac{\alpha_{\min}T}{16ec}.≥ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_δ end_ARG + divide start_ARG italic_c end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_α start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_ARG start_ARG 16 italic_e italic_c end_ARG .

(∗)(*)( ∗ ) follows from ℙm​(ℰ(m))≥1−δ{\mathbb{P}}_{m}({\mathcal{E}}^{(m)})\geq 1-\deltablackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_E start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ≥ 1 - italic_δ (as the algorithm is (ε,β,δ)(\varepsilon,\beta,\delta)( italic_ε , italic_β , italic_δ )-stable), Eqn. (15), and the following well-known properties of 𝗄𝗅{\mathsf{kl}}sansserif_kl:

  • •

    q↦𝗄𝗅​(p,q)q\mapsto{\mathsf{kl}}(p,q)italic_q ↦ sansserif_kl ( italic_p , italic_q ) is increasing in [p,1][p,1][ italic_p , 1 ], as

    ∂q𝗄𝗅​(p,q)=−pq+1−p1−q=q−pq​(1−q)≥0,\partial_{q}{\mathsf{kl}}(p,q)=-\frac{p}{q}+\frac{1-p}{1-q}=\frac{q-p}{q(1-q)}\geq 0,∂ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT sansserif_kl ( italic_p , italic_q ) = - divide start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_ARG italic_q end_ARG + divide start_ARG 1 - italic_p end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_q end_ARG = divide start_ARG italic_q - italic_p end_ARG start_ARG italic_q ( 1 - italic_q ) end_ARG ≥ 0 ,
  • •

    p↦𝗄𝗅​(p,q)p\mapsto{\mathsf{kl}}(p,q)italic_p ↦ sansserif_kl ( italic_p , italic_q ) is increasing on p∈[1/2,1]p\in[1/2,1]italic_p ∈ [ 1 / 2 , 1 ] when q<1/2q<1/2italic_q < 1 / 2, as

    ∂p𝗄𝗅​(p,q)=log⁡pq−log⁡1−p1−q=log⁡p1−p+1−qq≥0.\partial_{p}{\mathsf{kl}}(p,q)=\log\frac{p}{q}-\log\frac{1-p}{1-q}=\log\frac{p}{1-p}+\frac{1-q}{q}\geq 0.∂ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT sansserif_kl ( italic_p , italic_q ) = roman_log divide start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_ARG italic_q end_ARG - roman_log divide start_ARG 1 - italic_p end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_q end_ARG = roman_log divide start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_p end_ARG + divide start_ARG 1 - italic_q end_ARG start_ARG italic_q end_ARG ≥ 0 .

(∗∗)(**)( ∗ ∗ ) follows from 𝗄𝗅​(p,q)≥p​log⁡1q−log⁡2{\mathsf{kl}}(p,q)\geq p\log\frac{1}{q}-\log 2sansserif_kl ( italic_p , italic_q ) ≥ italic_p roman_log divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_q end_ARG - roman_log 2 (Eqn. (11) of Garivier et al. [2019]).

We conclude by rearranging the resulting inequality in terms of δ\deltaitalic_δ and optimizing over a≠b∈[K]{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a}\neq{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}b}\in[K]italic_a ≠ italic_b ∈ [ italic_K ].

∎(for non-asymptotic)

Asymptotic guarantee. Let m∗=arg​minm∈[MT]⁡ℙ0​[ℰ(m)]m^{*}=\operatorname*{arg\,min}_{m\in[M_{T}]}{\mathbb{P}}_{0}[{\mathcal{E}}^{(m)}]italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = start_OPERATOR roman_arg roman_min end_OPERATOR start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m ∈ [ italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ caligraphic_E start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]. Then,

ℙm∗​[𝒬T(m∗)≤log⁡MT]\displaystyle{\mathbb{P}}_{m^{*}}[{\mathcal{Q}}_{T}^{(m^{*})}\leq\log M_{T}]blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ caligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ roman_log italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] =ℙm∗​[𝒬T(m∗)≤log⁡MT,ℰ(m∗)]+ℙm∗​[𝒬T(m∗)≤log⁡MT,(ℰ(m∗))∁]\displaystyle={\mathbb{P}}_{m^{*}}\left[{\mathcal{Q}}_{T}^{(m^{*})}\leq\log M_{T},{\mathcal{E}}^{(m^{*})}\right]+{\mathbb{P}}_{m^{*}}\left[{\mathcal{Q}}_{T}^{(m^{*})}\leq\log M_{T},({\mathcal{E}}^{(m^{*})})^{\complement}\right]= blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ caligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ roman_log italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_E start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] + blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ caligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ roman_log italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ( caligraphic_E start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∁ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]
≤exp⁡(log⁡MT)​ℙ0​[𝒬T(m∗)≤log⁡MT,ℰ(m∗)]+ℙm∗​[(ℰ(m∗))∁]\displaystyle\leq\exp(\log M_{T}){\mathbb{P}}_{0}\left[{\mathcal{Q}}_{T}^{(m^{*})}\leq\log M_{T},{\mathcal{E}}^{(m^{*})}\right]+{\mathbb{P}}_{m^{*}}\left[({\mathcal{E}}^{(m^{*})})^{\complement}\right]≤ roman_exp ( roman_log italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ caligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ roman_log italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_E start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] + blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ( caligraphic_E start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∁ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] (change of measure from the alternate model m∗m^{*}italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to the true model)
≤MT​ℙ0​[ℰ(m∗)]+δT\displaystyle\leq M_{T}{\mathbb{P}}_{0}[{\mathcal{E}}^{(m^{*})}]+\delta_{T}≤ italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ caligraphic_E start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] + italic_δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
≤2​δT,\displaystyle\leq 2\delta_{T},≤ 2 italic_δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (Eqn. (16))

where (δT)T∈ℕ(\delta_{T})_{T\in{\mathbb{N}}}( italic_δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T ∈ blackboard_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is such that δT→0\delta_{T}\rightarrow 0italic_δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT → 0 as T→∞T\rightarrow\inftyitalic_T → ∞.

Thus, by Markov’s inequality,

1−2​δT\displaystyle 1-2\delta_{T}1 - 2 italic_δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ℙm∗​[𝒬T(m∗)>log⁡MT]\displaystyle\leq{\mathbb{P}}_{m^{*}}\left[{\mathcal{Q}}_{T}^{(m^{*})}>\log M_{T}\right]≤ blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ caligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > roman_log italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]
≤2​(H−1)​c​𝒟(a,b)log⁡MT\displaystyle\leq\frac{2(H-1)c{\mathcal{D}}^{({\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a},{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}b})}}{\log M_{T}}≤ divide start_ARG 2 ( italic_H - 1 ) italic_c caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_a , italic_b ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG roman_log italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG
≤2​(H−1)​c​𝒟(a,b)c​log⁡αb​T16​e​c+log⁡2.\displaystyle\leq\frac{2(H-1)c{\mathcal{D}}^{({\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a},{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}b})}}{c\log\frac{\alpha_{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}b}T}{16ec}+\log 2}.≤ divide start_ARG 2 ( italic_H - 1 ) italic_c caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_a , italic_b ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_c roman_log divide start_ARG italic_α start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_ARG start_ARG 16 italic_e italic_c end_ARG + roman_log 2 end_ARG . (Lemma A.1)
≤2​(H−1)​c​𝒟(a,b)c​log⁡αmin​T16​e​c+log⁡2.\displaystyle\leq\frac{2(H-1)c{\mathcal{D}}^{({\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a},{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}b})}}{c\log\frac{\alpha_{\min}T}{16ec}+\log 2}.≤ divide start_ARG 2 ( italic_H - 1 ) italic_c caligraphic_D start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_a , italic_b ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_c roman_log divide start_ARG italic_α start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_ARG start_ARG 16 italic_e italic_c end_ARG + roman_log 2 end_ARG .

Taking the min over a≠b∈[K]{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}a}\neq{\color[rgb]{0,0,1}\definecolor[named]{pgfstrokecolor}{rgb}{0,0,1}b}\in[K]italic_a ≠ italic_b ∈ [ italic_K ] and the limit n→∞n\rightarrow\inftyitalic_n → ∞, we have that

lim infT→∞2​(H−1)​𝒟log⁡αmin16​e​ε≥1.\liminf_{T\rightarrow\infty}\frac{2(H-1){\mathcal{D}}}{\log\frac{\alpha_{\min}}{16e\varepsilon}}\geq 1.lim inf start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T → ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG 2 ( italic_H - 1 ) caligraphic_D end_ARG start_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_α start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 16 italic_e italic_ε end_ARG end_ARG ≥ 1 . (19)

∎(for asymptotic)

Proof of Proposition A.1.

Positivity and symmetricity are trivial. Thus, it remains to show the triangle inequality. Let f,g,h∈ℱ​(T,K)f,g,h\in{\mathcal{F}}(T,K)italic_f , italic_g , italic_h ∈ caligraphic_F ( italic_T , italic_K ). Then,

ET​(f,h)\displaystyle E_{T}(f,h)italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_f , italic_h ) =minσ∈Sym​(K)​∑t∈[T]𝟙​[f​(t)≠σ​(h​(t))]\displaystyle=\min_{\sigma\in\mathrm{Sym}(K)}\sum_{t\in[T]}\mathds{1}[f(t)\neq\sigma(h(t))]= roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ∈ roman_Sym ( italic_K ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t ∈ [ italic_T ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_1 [ italic_f ( italic_t ) ≠ italic_σ ( italic_h ( italic_t ) ) ]
≤minν∈Sym​(K)⁡minσ∈Sym​(K)​∑t∈[T]𝟙​[f​(t)≠ν​(g​(t))∨ν​(g​(t))≠σ​(h​(t))]\displaystyle\leq\min_{\nu\in\mathrm{Sym}(K)}\min_{\sigma\in\mathrm{Sym}(K)}\sum_{t\in[T]}\mathds{1}[f(t)\neq\nu(g(t))\vee\nu(g(t))\neq\sigma(h(t))]≤ roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ν ∈ roman_Sym ( italic_K ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ∈ roman_Sym ( italic_K ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t ∈ [ italic_T ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_1 [ italic_f ( italic_t ) ≠ italic_ν ( italic_g ( italic_t ) ) ∨ italic_ν ( italic_g ( italic_t ) ) ≠ italic_σ ( italic_h ( italic_t ) ) ]
≤minν∈Sym​(K)⁡minσ∈Sym​(K)​∑t∈[T](𝟙​[f​(t)≠ν​(g​(t))]+𝟙​[ν​(g​(t))≠σ​(h​(t))])\displaystyle\leq\min_{\nu\in\mathrm{Sym}(K)}\min_{\sigma\in\mathrm{Sym}(K)}\sum_{t\in[T]}\left(\mathds{1}[f(t)\neq\nu(g(t))]+\mathds{1}[\nu(g(t))\neq\sigma(h(t))]\right)≤ roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ν ∈ roman_Sym ( italic_K ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ∈ roman_Sym ( italic_K ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t ∈ [ italic_T ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( blackboard_1 [ italic_f ( italic_t ) ≠ italic_ν ( italic_g ( italic_t ) ) ] + blackboard_1 [ italic_ν ( italic_g ( italic_t ) ) ≠ italic_σ ( italic_h ( italic_t ) ) ] )
≤minν∈Sym​(K)​∑t∈[T]𝟙​[f​(t)≠ν​(g​(t))]+minν∈Sym​(K)⁡minσ∈Sym​(K)​∑t∈[T]𝟙​[ν​(g​(t))≠σ​(h​(t))]\displaystyle\leq\min_{\nu\in\mathrm{Sym}(K)}\sum_{t\in[T]}\mathds{1}[f(t)\neq\nu(g(t))]+\min_{\nu\in\mathrm{Sym}(K)}\min_{\sigma\in\mathrm{Sym}(K)}\sum_{t\in[T]}\mathds{1}[\nu(g(t))\neq\sigma(h(t))]≤ roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ν ∈ roman_Sym ( italic_K ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t ∈ [ italic_T ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_1 [ italic_f ( italic_t ) ≠ italic_ν ( italic_g ( italic_t ) ) ] + roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ν ∈ roman_Sym ( italic_K ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ∈ roman_Sym ( italic_K ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t ∈ [ italic_T ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_1 [ italic_ν ( italic_g ( italic_t ) ) ≠ italic_σ ( italic_h ( italic_t ) ) ]
=ET​(f,g)+minν′∈Sym​(K)⁡𝟙​[g​(t)≠ν′​(h​(t))]\displaystyle=E_{T}(f,g)+\min_{\nu^{\prime}\in\mathrm{Sym}(K)}\mathds{1}[g(t)\neq\nu^{\prime}(h(t))]= italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_f , italic_g ) + roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ν start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ roman_Sym ( italic_K ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_1 [ italic_g ( italic_t ) ≠ italic_ν start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_h ( italic_t ) ) ] (ν′=ν−1∘σ\nu^{\prime}=\nu^{-1}\circ\sigmaitalic_ν start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_ν start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∘ italic_σ)
=ET​(f,g)+ET​(g,h).\displaystyle=E_{T}(f,g)+E_{T}(g,h).= italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_f , italic_g ) + italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_g , italic_h ) .

∎

Appendix B Proof of Theorem 4.1 – Initial Spectral Clustering

We remark in advance that the proofs of all supporting lemmas and propositions are deferred to the end of this section.

We begin by establishing the following concentration result for 𝑾^\widehat{{\bm{W}}}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_W end_ARG:

Lemma B.1 (Concentration of 𝑾^\widehat{{\bm{W}}}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_W end_ARG to 𝑾{\bm{W}}bold_italic_W).

Let δ∈(0,1)\delta\in(0,1)italic_δ ∈ ( 0 , 1 ). For each s∈𝒮s\in{\mathcal{S}}italic_s ∈ caligraphic_S and t∈[T]t\in[T]italic_t ∈ [ italic_T ], the following holds with probability at least 1−δ1-\delta1 - italic_δ, given that H≥(251−π​(s)∨52)​2π​(s)​γps​log⁡8πmin​δ2H\geq\left(\frac{25}{1-\pi(s)}\vee 52\right)\frac{2}{\pi(s)\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}\log\frac{8}{\pi_{\min}\delta^{2}}italic_H ≥ ( divide start_ARG 25 end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_π ( italic_s ) end_ARG ∨ 52 ) divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_π ( italic_s ) italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 8 end_ARG start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG:

∥π(f​(t))​(s)p(f​(t))(⋅|s)−1H​N^t​(s)N^t(s,⋅)∥2≤42H​γps​log⁡8​(H​π​(s)+1)πmin​δ2.\left\lVert\sqrt{\pi^{(f(t))}(s)}p^{(f(t))}(\cdot|s)-\frac{1}{\sqrt{H\widehat{N}_{t}(s)}}\widehat{N}_{t}(s,\cdot)\right\rVert_{2}\leq 4\sqrt{\frac{2}{H\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}\log\frac{8(H\pi(s)+1)}{\pi_{\min}\delta^{2}}}.∥ square-root start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ( italic_t ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) end_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ( italic_t ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ⋅ | italic_s ) - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_H over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s ) end_ARG end_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , ⋅ ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ 4 square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_H italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 8 ( italic_H italic_π ( italic_s ) + 1 ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG . (20)

If we additionally assume that H≥9​π​(s)πminH\geq\frac{9\pi(s)}{\pi_{\min}}italic_H ≥ divide start_ARG 9 italic_π ( italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG, the following holds with probability at least 1−δ1-\delta1 - italic_δ:

|(𝑾)t,:−(𝑾^)t,:|≤r^≜8​SH​γps​log⁡Hδ⟹‖𝑾−𝑾^‖2→∞≤8​SH​γps​log⁡T​Hδ.\left|({\bm{W}})_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-(\widehat{{\bm{W}}})_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right|\leq\widehat{r}\triangleq 8\sqrt{\frac{S}{H\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}\log\frac{H}{\delta}}\Longrightarrow\left\lVert{\bm{W}}-\widehat{{\bm{W}}}\right\rVert_{2\rightarrow\infty}\leq 8\sqrt{\frac{S}{H\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}\log\frac{TH}{\delta}}.| ( bold_italic_W ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - ( over^ start_ARG bold_italic_W end_ARG ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | ≤ over^ start_ARG italic_r end_ARG ≜ 8 square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG italic_S end_ARG start_ARG italic_H italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG end_ARG ⟹ ∥ bold_italic_W - over^ start_ARG bold_italic_W end_ARG ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 → ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ 8 square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG italic_S end_ARG start_ARG italic_H italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_T italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG end_ARG . (21)

First, as ‖𝑾−𝑾^‖2≤T​‖𝑾−𝑾^‖2→∞\left\lVert{\bm{W}}-\widehat{{\bm{W}}}\right\rVert_{2}\leq\sqrt{T}\left\lVert{\bm{W}}-\widehat{{\bm{W}}}\right\rVert_{2\rightarrow\infty}∥ bold_italic_W - over^ start_ARG bold_italic_W end_ARG ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ square-root start_ARG italic_T end_ARG ∥ bold_italic_W - over^ start_ARG bold_italic_W end_ARG ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 → ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [Cape et al., 2019, Proposition 6.3], with our choice of σ^thres:=8T​SH​γps​log⁡T​Hδ\widehat{\sigma}_{\mathrm{thres}}\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=8\sqrt{\frac{TS}{H\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}\log\frac{TH}{\delta}}over^ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_thres end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : = 8 square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG italic_T italic_S end_ARG start_ARG italic_H italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_T italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG end_ARG (line 3), we have from Lemma B.1 and Weyl’s inequality for singular values [Horn and Johnson, 2012, Problem 7.3.P16] that ℙ​(R^≤R=rank​(𝑾))≥1−δ{\mathbb{P}}\left(\widehat{R}\leq R=\mathrm{rank}({\bm{W}})\right)\geq 1-\deltablackboard_P ( over^ start_ARG italic_R end_ARG ≤ italic_R = roman_rank ( bold_italic_W ) ) ≥ 1 - italic_δ. We will condition on this event throughout the remainder of the proof.

Then, we have that

‖𝑿^​𝑽^1:R⊤−𝑾‖F2\displaystyle\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{X}}}\widehat{{\bm{V}}}_{1\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}R}^{\top}-{\bm{W}}\right\rVert_{F}^{2}∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_X end_ARG over^ start_ARG bold_italic_V end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - bold_italic_W ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤2​R​‖𝑿^​𝑽^1:R⊤−𝑾‖22\displaystyle\leq 2R\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{X}}}\widehat{{\bm{V}}}_{1\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}R}^{\top}-{\bm{W}}\right\rVert_{2}^{2}≤ 2 italic_R ∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_X end_ARG over^ start_ARG bold_italic_V end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - bold_italic_W ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT
≤4​R​(‖𝑿^​𝑽^1:R⊤−𝑾^‖22+‖𝑾^−𝑾‖22)\displaystyle\leq 4R\left(\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{X}}}\widehat{{\bm{V}}}_{1\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}R}^{\top}-\widehat{{\bm{W}}}\right\rVert_{2}^{2}+\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{W}}}-{\bm{W}}\right\rVert_{2}^{2}\right)≤ 4 italic_R ( ∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_X end_ARG over^ start_ARG bold_italic_V end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over^ start_ARG bold_italic_W end_ARG ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_W end_ARG - bold_italic_W ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )
≤8​R​(σ^thres)2,\displaystyle\leq 8R(\widehat{\sigma}_{\mathrm{thres}})^{2},≤ 8 italic_R ( over^ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_thres end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , (with probability at least 1−δ1-\delta1 - italic_δ)
=29​R​T​SH​γps​log⁡T​Hδ.\displaystyle=2^{9}R\frac{TS}{H\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}\log\frac{TH}{\delta}.= 2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 9 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_R divide start_ARG italic_T italic_S end_ARG start_ARG italic_H italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_T italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG .

Let us denote 𝒀^:=𝑿^𝑽^1:R\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=\widehat{{\bm{X}}}\widehat{{\bm{V}}}_{1\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}R}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG : = over^ start_ARG bold_italic_X end_ARG over^ start_ARG bold_italic_V end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. We now have the following lemma:

Lemma B.2.

If t∈[T]t\in[T]italic_t ∈ [ italic_T ] is misclassified from Algorithm 1, then ‖𝐘^t,:−𝐖t,:‖2≥Δ𝐖4\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-{\bm{W}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}\geq\frac{\Delta_{\bm{W}}}{4}∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≥ divide start_ARG roman_Δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_W end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 4 end_ARG.

Then, we have that with probability at least 1−δ1-\delta1 - italic_δ,

ET​(f^0,f)≤‖𝒀^−𝑾‖F2Δ𝑾224≤213​T​R​SH​γps​Δ𝑾2​log⁡T​Hδ.E_{T}(\widehat{f}_{0},f)\leq\frac{\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}-{\bm{W}}\right\rVert_{F}^{2}}{\frac{\Delta_{\bm{W}}^{2}}{2^{4}}}\leq\frac{2^{13}TRS}{H\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}\Delta_{\bm{W}}^{2}}\log\frac{TH}{\delta}.italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_f end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_f ) ≤ divide start_ARG ∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG - bold_italic_W ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG divide start_ARG roman_Δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_W end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 4 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG ≤ divide start_ARG 2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 13 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T italic_R italic_S end_ARG start_ARG italic_H italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_W end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_T italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG .

∎

B.1 Proof of Lemma B.1

Note that

∥π(f​(t))​(s)p(f​(t))(⋅|s)−1H​N^t​(s)N^t(s,⋅)∥2\displaystyle\left\lVert\sqrt{\pi^{(f(t))}(s)}p^{(f(t))}(\cdot|s)-\frac{1}{\sqrt{H\widehat{N}_{t}(s)}}\widehat{N}_{t}(s,\cdot)\right\rVert_{2}∥ square-root start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ( italic_t ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) end_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ( italic_t ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ⋅ | italic_s ) - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_H over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s ) end_ARG end_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , ⋅ ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
≤π(f​(t))​(s)​∥p(f​(t))(⋅|s)−N^t​(s,⋅)N^t​(s)∥2⏟(i)+|π(f​(t))​(s)−N^t​(s)H|⏟(i​i)​‖N^t​(s,⋅)N^t​(s)‖2\displaystyle\leq\sqrt{\pi^{(f(t))}(s)}\underbrace{\left\lVert p^{(f(t))}(\cdot|s)-\frac{\widehat{N}_{t}(s,\cdot)}{\widehat{N}_{t}(s)}\right\rVert_{2}}_{(i)}+\underbrace{\left|\sqrt{\pi^{(f(t))}(s)}-\sqrt{\frac{\widehat{N}_{t}(s)}{H}}\right|}_{(ii)}\left\lVert\frac{\widehat{N}_{t}(s,\cdot)}{\widehat{N}_{t}(s)}\right\rVert_{2}≤ square-root start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ( italic_t ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) end_ARG under⏟ start_ARG ∥ italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ( italic_t ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ⋅ | italic_s ) - divide start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , ⋅ ) end_ARG start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s ) end_ARG ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + under⏟ start_ARG | square-root start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ( italic_t ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) end_ARG - square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_H end_ARG end_ARG | end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i italic_i ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ divide start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , ⋅ ) end_ARG start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s ) end_ARG ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

Let us bound (i)(i)( italic_i ) and (i​i)(ii)( italic_i italic_i ) separately. For simplicity, we omit the dependency on t∈[T]t\in[T]italic_t ∈ [ italic_T ].

Bounding (i)(i)( italic_i ). Here, we follow the proof strategy of Wolfer and Kontorovich [2021, Theorem 3.1], with two crucial modifications: the quantity being bounded is the ℓ2\ell_{2}roman_ℓ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-norm (not ℓ1\ell_{1}roman_ℓ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-norm) error, and we only need to bound the error stemming from a single state ssitalic_s.

Let ns∈ℕn_{s}\in{\mathbb{N}}italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ blackboard_N to be determined later, and let ℙπ{\mathbb{P}}_{\pi}blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be the probability measure induced when the Markov chain starts from its stationary distribution. Then,

ℙπ(∥p(⋅|s)−N^​(s,⋅)N^​(s)∥2>ε)\displaystyle{\mathbb{P}}_{\pi}\left(\left\lVert p(\cdot|s)-\frac{\widehat{N}(s,\cdot)}{\widehat{N}(s)}\right\rVert_{2}>\varepsilon\right)blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ∥ italic_p ( ⋅ | italic_s ) - divide start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( italic_s , ⋅ ) end_ARG start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( italic_s ) end_ARG ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > italic_ε )
≤∑n=ns3​nsℙπ(∥p(⋅|s)−N^​(s,⋅)N^​(s)∥2>ε,N^(s)=ns)+ℙπ(N^(s)∉⟦ns,3ns⟧).\displaystyle\leq\sum_{n=n_{s}}^{3n_{s}}{\mathbb{P}}_{\pi}\left(\left\lVert p(\cdot|s)-\frac{\widehat{N}(s,\cdot)}{\widehat{N}(s)}\right\rVert_{2}>\varepsilon,\ \widehat{N}(s)=n_{s}\right)+{\mathbb{P}}_{\pi}\left(\widehat{N}(s)\not\in\llbracket n_{s},3n_{s}\rrbracket\right).≤ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n = italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 3 italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ∥ italic_p ( ⋅ | italic_s ) - divide start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( italic_s , ⋅ ) end_ARG start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( italic_s ) end_ARG ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > italic_ε , over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( italic_s ) = italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( italic_s ) ∉ ⟦ italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , 3 italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⟧ ) .

For the first term, we utilize the scheme of reducing learning the Markovian transition kernel to learning a discrete distribution, as described in the proof of Billingsley [1961, Theorem 3.1]. Then, denoting p^n(⋅|s)\widehat{p}_{n}(\cdot|s)over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ | italic_s ) to be the estimate of p(⋅|s)p(\cdot|s)italic_p ( ⋅ | italic_s ) from nnitalic_n i.i.d. samples of p(⋅|s)p(\cdot|s)italic_p ( ⋅ | italic_s ), we have that

∑n=ns3​nsℙπ(∥p(⋅|s)−N^​(s,⋅)N^​(s)∥2>ε,N^(s)=n)\displaystyle\sum_{n=n_{s}}^{3n_{s}}{\mathbb{P}}_{\pi}\left(\left\lVert p(\cdot|s)-\frac{\widehat{N}(s,\cdot)}{\widehat{N}(s)}\right\rVert_{2}>\varepsilon,\ \widehat{N}(s)=n\right)∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n = italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 3 italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ∥ italic_p ( ⋅ | italic_s ) - divide start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( italic_s , ⋅ ) end_ARG start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( italic_s ) end_ARG ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > italic_ε , over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( italic_s ) = italic_n ) ≤∑n=ns3​nsℙπ(∥p(⋅|s)−p^n(⋅|s)∥2>ε)\displaystyle\leq\sum_{n=n_{s}}^{3n_{s}}{\mathbb{P}}_{\pi}\left(\left\lVert p(\cdot|s)-\widehat{p}_{n}(\cdot|s)\right\rVert_{2}>\varepsilon\right)≤ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n = italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 3 italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ∥ italic_p ( ⋅ | italic_s ) - over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ | italic_s ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > italic_ε )
≤(∗)​∑n=ns3​nsexp⁡(−ε2​n2)\displaystyle\overset{(*)}{\leq}\sum_{n=n_{s}}^{3n_{s}}\exp\left(-\frac{\varepsilon^{2}n}{2}\right)start_OVERACCENT ( ∗ ) end_OVERACCENT start_ARG ≤ end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n = italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 3 italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG italic_ε start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG )
≤(2​ns+1)​exp⁡(−ε2​ns2),\displaystyle\leq(2n_{s}+1)\exp\left(-\frac{\varepsilon^{2}n_{s}}{2}\right),≤ ( 2 italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 ) roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG italic_ε start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ) ,

where (∗)(*)( ∗ ) follows from the following ℓ2\ell_{2}roman_ℓ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-concentration of learning discrete distribution:

Lemma B.3 (Theorem 9 of Canonne [2020]).

Let 𝒮{\mathcal{S}}caligraphic_S be a finite state space, p∈𝒫​(𝒮)p\in{\mathcal{P}}({\mathcal{S}})italic_p ∈ caligraphic_P ( caligraphic_S ), and δ∈(0,1)\delta\in(0,1)italic_δ ∈ ( 0 , 1 ). We are given {si}i∈[N]\{s_{i}\}_{i\in[N]}{ italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ∈ [ italic_N ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT with si​∼i.i.d.​ps_{i}\overset{i.i.d.}{\sim}pitalic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_OVERACCENT italic_i . italic_i . italic_d . end_OVERACCENT start_ARG ∼ end_ARG italic_p. Let p^N∈𝒫​(𝒮)\hat{p}_{N}\in{\mathcal{P}}({\mathcal{S}})over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_P ( caligraphic_S ) be defined as p^N(s):=1N∑i∈[N]𝟙[si=s]\hat{p}_{N}(s)\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=\frac{1}{N}\sum_{i\in[N]}\mathds{1}[s_{i}=s]over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s ) : = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ∈ [ italic_N ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_1 [ italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_s ] for each s∈𝒮s\in{\mathcal{S}}italic_s ∈ caligraphic_S. Then, we have the following:

ℙ​(‖p−p^N‖2≥ε)≤exp⁡(−ε2​N2),{\mathbb{P}}\left(\left\lVert p-\hat{p}_{N}\right\rVert_{2}\geq\varepsilon\right)\leq\exp\left(-\frac{\varepsilon^{2}N}{2}\right),blackboard_P ( ∥ italic_p - over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≥ italic_ε ) ≤ roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG italic_ε start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ) , (22)

We now choose ns=H​π​(s)2n_{s}=\frac{H\pi(s)}{2}italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG italic_H italic_π ( italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG and utilize the Markovian Bernstein concentration, which we recall here:

Lemma B.4 (Theorem 3.4 of Paulin [2015]).

Suppose of (Xh)h≥1(X_{h})_{h\geq 1}( italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h ≥ 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is an ergodic Markov chain over 𝒮{\mathcal{S}}caligraphic_S with transition probability ppitalic_p, initial distribution μ\muitalic_μ, and pseudo spectral gap γps\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Let ϕ∈L2​(π)\phi\in L^{2}(\pi)italic_ϕ ∈ italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_π ) with sups∈𝒮|ϕ​(s)−𝔼π​[ϕ]|≤C\sup_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}}|\phi(s)-\mathbb{E}_{\pi}[\phi]|\leq Croman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∈ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_ϕ ( italic_s ) - blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_ϕ ] | ≤ italic_C for some C>0C>0italic_C > 0, and Vϕ:=Varπ[ϕ]V_{\phi}\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=\mathrm{Var}_{\pi}[\phi]italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ϕ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : = roman_Var start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_ϕ ]. Then, we have the following: for any u≥0u\geq 0italic_u ≥ 0,

ℙ​(∑h=1H(ϕ​(Xh)−𝔼π​[ϕ​(Xh)])≥u)≤exp⁡(−u2​γps8​(H+1γps)​Vϕ+20​C​u).{\mathbb{P}}\left(\sum_{h=1}^{H}(\phi(X_{h})-\mathbb{E}_{\pi}[\phi(X_{h})])\geq u\right)\leq\exp\left(-\frac{u^{2}\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}{8\left(H+\frac{1}{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}\right)V_{\phi}+20Cu}\right).blackboard_P ( ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_ϕ ( italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_ϕ ( italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] ) ≥ italic_u ) ≤ roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 8 ( italic_H + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) italic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ϕ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 20 italic_C italic_u end_ARG ) . (23)

For two integers a≥ba\geq bitalic_a ≥ italic_b, denote ⟦a,b⟧:={a,a+1,⋯,b}\llbracket a,b\rrbracket\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=\{a,a+1,\cdots,b\}⟦ italic_a , italic_b ⟧ : = { italic_a , italic_a + 1 , ⋯ , italic_b }. We then have that

ℙπ​(N^​(s)∉⟦H​π​(s)2,3​H​π​(s)2⟧)\displaystyle{\mathbb{P}}_{\pi}\left(\widehat{N}(s)\not\in\left\llbracket\frac{H\pi(s)}{2},\frac{3H\pi(s)}{2}\right\rrbracket\right)blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( italic_s ) ∉ ⟦ divide start_ARG italic_H italic_π ( italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG , divide start_ARG 3 italic_H italic_π ( italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ⟧ ) =ℙπ​(N^​(s)−H​π​(s)∉⟦−H​π​(s)2,H​π​(s)2⟧)\displaystyle={\mathbb{P}}_{\pi}\left(\widehat{N}(s)-H\pi(s)\not\in\left\llbracket-\frac{H\pi(s)}{2},\frac{H\pi(s)}{2}\right\rrbracket\right)= blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( italic_s ) - italic_H italic_π ( italic_s ) ∉ ⟦ - divide start_ARG italic_H italic_π ( italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG , divide start_ARG italic_H italic_π ( italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ⟧ )
≤ℙπ​(|N^​(s)−H​π​(s)|>H​π​(s)2)\displaystyle\leq{\mathbb{P}}_{\pi}\left(\left|\widehat{N}(s)-H\pi(s)\right|>\frac{H\pi(s)}{2}\right)≤ blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( | over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( italic_s ) - italic_H italic_π ( italic_s ) | > divide start_ARG italic_H italic_π ( italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG )
≤2​exp⁡(−(H​π​(s)/2)2​γps8​(H+1γps)​π​(s)​(1−π​(s))+20​(H​π​(s)/2))\displaystyle\leq 2\exp\left(-\frac{(H\pi(s)/2)^{2}\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}{8\left(H+\frac{1}{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}\right)\pi(s)(1-\pi(s))+20(H\pi(s)/2)}\right)≤ 2 roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG ( italic_H italic_π ( italic_s ) / 2 ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 8 ( italic_H + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) italic_π ( italic_s ) ( 1 - italic_π ( italic_s ) ) + 20 ( italic_H italic_π ( italic_s ) / 2 ) end_ARG )
≤2​exp⁡(−H​π​(s)​γps104).\displaystyle\leq 2\exp\left(-\frac{H\pi(s)\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}{104}\right).≤ 2 roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG italic_H italic_π ( italic_s ) italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 104 end_ARG ) . (Assume that H>1γpsH>\frac{1}{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}italic_H > divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG)

Combining everything, we have that

ℙπ(∥p(⋅|s)−N^​(s,⋅)N^​(s)∥2>ε)≤(Hπ(s)+1)exp(−ε2​H​π​(s)2)+2exp(−H​π​(s)​γps104),{\mathbb{P}}_{\pi}\left(\left\lVert p(\cdot|s)-\frac{\widehat{N}(s,\cdot)}{\widehat{N}(s)}\right\rVert_{2}>\varepsilon\right)\leq(H\pi(s)+1)\exp\left(-\frac{\varepsilon^{2}H\pi(s)}{2}\right)+2\exp\left(-\frac{H\pi(s)\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}{104}\right),blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ∥ italic_p ( ⋅ | italic_s ) - divide start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( italic_s , ⋅ ) end_ARG start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( italic_s ) end_ARG ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > italic_ε ) ≤ ( italic_H italic_π ( italic_s ) + 1 ) roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG italic_ε start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H italic_π ( italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ) + 2 roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG italic_H italic_π ( italic_s ) italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 104 end_ARG ) ,

and thus, with H≥1γps∨104π​(s)​γps​log⁡2δH\geq\frac{1}{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}\vee\frac{104}{\pi(s)\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}\log\frac{2}{\delta}italic_H ≥ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ∨ divide start_ARG 104 end_ARG start_ARG italic_π ( italic_s ) italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG, we have that

ℙπ(∥p(⋅|s)−N^​(s,⋅)N^​(s)∥2>2H​π​(s)​log⁡2​(H​π​(s)+1)δ)≤δ.{\mathbb{P}}_{\pi}\left(\left\lVert p(\cdot|s)-\frac{\widehat{N}(s,\cdot)}{\widehat{N}(s)}\right\rVert_{2}>\sqrt{\frac{2}{H\pi(s)}\log\frac{2(H\pi(s)+1)}{\delta}}\right)\leq\delta.blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ∥ italic_p ( ⋅ | italic_s ) - divide start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( italic_s , ⋅ ) end_ARG start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( italic_s ) end_ARG ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_H italic_π ( italic_s ) end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 2 ( italic_H italic_π ( italic_s ) + 1 ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG end_ARG ) ≤ italic_δ . (24)

Here, we recall the following result that quantifies the price of non-stationarity due to the initial distribution μ\muitalic_μ not necessarily being the stationary distribution π\piitalic_π:

Lemma B.5 (Proposition 3.10 of Paulin [2015]).

Let (X1,⋯,XH)(X_{1},\cdots,X_{H})( italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) be a (time-homogeneous) Markov chain with stationary distribution π\piitalic_π. For any measurable g:𝒮H→ℝg\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}{\mathcal{S}}^{H}\rightarrow{\mathbb{R}}italic_g : caligraphic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT → blackboard_R and initial distribution μ∈Δ​(𝒮)\mu\in\Delta({\mathcal{S}})italic_μ ∈ roman_Δ ( caligraphic_S ), we have that for any u≥0u\geq 0italic_u ≥ 0,

ℙμ​(g​(X1,⋯,XH)≥u)≤[∑s∈𝒮μ​(s)2π​(s)]​ℙπ​(g​(X1,⋯,XH)≥u).{\mathbb{P}}_{\mu}\left(g(X_{1},\cdots,X_{H})\geq u\right)\leq\sqrt{\left[\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}}\frac{\mu(s)^{2}}{\pi(s)}\right]{\mathbb{P}}_{\pi}\left(g(X_{1},\cdots,X_{H})\geq u\right)}.blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_μ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_g ( italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≥ italic_u ) ≤ square-root start_ARG [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∈ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_μ ( italic_s ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_π ( italic_s ) end_ARG ] blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_g ( italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≥ italic_u ) end_ARG . (25)

Especially as |𝒮|<∞|{\mathcal{S}}|<\infty| caligraphic_S | < ∞, we can bound ∑s∈𝒮μ​(s)2π​(s)≤1πmin\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}}\frac{\mu(s)^{2}}{\pi(s)}\leq\frac{1}{\pi_{\min}}∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∈ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_μ ( italic_s ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_π ( italic_s ) end_ARG ≤ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG.

Thus,

ℙ(∥p(⋅|s)−N^​(s,⋅)N^​(s)∥2>2H​π​(s)​log⁡2​(H​π​(s)+1)δ)≤δπmin.{\mathbb{P}}\left(\left\lVert p(\cdot|s)-\frac{\widehat{N}(s,\cdot)}{\widehat{N}(s)}\right\rVert_{2}>\sqrt{\frac{2}{H\pi(s)}\log\frac{2(H\pi(s)+1)}{\delta}}\right)\leq\sqrt{\frac{\delta}{\pi_{\min}}}.blackboard_P ( ∥ italic_p ( ⋅ | italic_s ) - divide start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( italic_s , ⋅ ) end_ARG start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( italic_s ) end_ARG ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_H italic_π ( italic_s ) end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 2 ( italic_H italic_π ( italic_s ) + 1 ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG end_ARG ) ≤ square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG .

Reparametrizing finally gives

ℙ(∥p(⋅|s)−N^​(s,⋅)N^​(s)∥2>2H​π​(s)​log⁡8​(H​π​(s)+1)πmin​δ2)≤δ2,{\mathbb{P}}\left(\left\lVert p(\cdot|s)-\frac{\widehat{N}(s,\cdot)}{\widehat{N}(s)}\right\rVert_{2}>\sqrt{\frac{2}{H\pi(s)}\log\frac{8(H\pi(s)+1)}{\pi_{\min}\delta^{2}}}\right)\leq\frac{\delta}{2},blackboard_P ( ∥ italic_p ( ⋅ | italic_s ) - divide start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( italic_s , ⋅ ) end_ARG start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( italic_s ) end_ARG ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_H italic_π ( italic_s ) end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 8 ( italic_H italic_π ( italic_s ) + 1 ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG ) ≤ divide start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG , (26)

given that H≥1γps∨104π​(s)​γps​log⁡8πmin​δ2H\geq\frac{1}{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}\vee\frac{104}{\pi(s)\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}\log\frac{8}{\pi_{\min}\delta^{2}}italic_H ≥ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ∨ divide start_ARG 104 end_ARG start_ARG italic_π ( italic_s ) italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 8 end_ARG start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG.

Bounding (i​i)(ii)( italic_i italic_i ). Note that

|π​(s)−N^​(s)H|=|π​(s)−N^​(s)H|π​(s)+N^​(s)H≤1π​(s)​|π​(s)−N^​(s)H|.\left|\sqrt{\pi(s)}-\sqrt{\frac{\widehat{N}(s)}{H}}\right|=\frac{\left|\pi(s)-\frac{\widehat{N}(s)}{H}\right|}{\sqrt{\pi(s)}+\sqrt{\frac{\widehat{N}(s)}{H}}}\leq\frac{1}{\sqrt{\pi(s)}}\left|\pi(s)-\frac{\widehat{N}(s)}{H}\right|.| square-root start_ARG italic_π ( italic_s ) end_ARG - square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_H end_ARG end_ARG | = divide start_ARG | italic_π ( italic_s ) - divide start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_H end_ARG | end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_π ( italic_s ) end_ARG + square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_H end_ARG end_ARG end_ARG ≤ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_π ( italic_s ) end_ARG end_ARG | italic_π ( italic_s ) - divide start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_H end_ARG | .

Again, we invoke Lemma B.4:

ℙπ​(|π​(s)−N^​(s)H|>32​π​(s)​(1−π​(s))H​γps​log⁡8πmin​δ2)\displaystyle{\mathbb{P}}_{\pi}\left(\left|\pi(s)-\frac{\widehat{N}(s)}{H}\right|>\sqrt{\frac{32\pi(s)(1-\pi(s))}{H\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}\log\frac{8}{\pi_{\min}\delta^{2}}}\right)blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( | italic_π ( italic_s ) - divide start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_H end_ARG | > square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG 32 italic_π ( italic_s ) ( 1 - italic_π ( italic_s ) ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_H italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 8 end_ARG start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG )
≤2​exp⁡(−32​π​(s)​(1−π​(s))​H​log⁡8πmin​δ28​(H+1γps)​π​(s)​(1−π​(s))+20​32​π​(s)​(1−π​(s))​Hγps​log⁡8πmin​γps)\displaystyle\leq 2\exp\left(-\frac{32\pi(s)(1-\pi(s))H\log\frac{8}{\pi_{\min}\delta^{2}}}{8\left(H+\frac{1}{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}\right)\pi(s)(1-\pi(s))+20\sqrt{\frac{32\pi(s)(1-\pi(s))H}{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}\log\frac{8}{\pi_{\min}\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}}}\right)≤ 2 roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG 32 italic_π ( italic_s ) ( 1 - italic_π ( italic_s ) ) italic_H roman_log divide start_ARG 8 end_ARG start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG 8 ( italic_H + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) italic_π ( italic_s ) ( 1 - italic_π ( italic_s ) ) + 20 square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG 32 italic_π ( italic_s ) ( 1 - italic_π ( italic_s ) ) italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 8 end_ARG start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG end_ARG )
≤2​exp⁡(−2​H​π​(s)​(1−π​(s))​log⁡8πmin​δ2H​π​(s)​(1−π​(s))+5​2γps​log⁡8πmin​δ2)\displaystyle\leq 2\exp\left(-\frac{2\sqrt{H\pi(s)(1-\pi(s))}\log\frac{8}{\pi_{\min}\delta^{2}}}{\sqrt{H\pi(s)(1-\pi(s))}+5\sqrt{\frac{2}{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}\log\frac{8}{\pi_{\min}\delta^{2}}}}\right)≤ 2 roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG 2 square-root start_ARG italic_H italic_π ( italic_s ) ( 1 - italic_π ( italic_s ) ) end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 8 end_ARG start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_H italic_π ( italic_s ) ( 1 - italic_π ( italic_s ) ) end_ARG + 5 square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 8 end_ARG start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG end_ARG ) (H≥1γpsH\geq\frac{1}{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}italic_H ≥ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG)
≤2​exp⁡(−2​H​π​(s)​(1−π​(s))​log⁡8πmin​δ22​H​π​(s)​(1−π​(s)))\displaystyle\leq 2\exp\left(-\frac{2\sqrt{H\pi(s)(1-\pi(s))}\log\frac{8}{\pi_{\min}\delta^{2}}}{2\sqrt{H\pi(s)(1-\pi(s))}}\right)≤ 2 roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG 2 square-root start_ARG italic_H italic_π ( italic_s ) ( 1 - italic_π ( italic_s ) ) end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 8 end_ARG start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG 2 square-root start_ARG italic_H italic_π ( italic_s ) ( 1 - italic_π ( italic_s ) ) end_ARG end_ARG ) (H≥50π​(s)​(1−π​(s))​γps​log⁡8πmin​δ2H\geq\frac{50}{\pi(s)(1-\pi(s))\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}\log\frac{8}{\pi_{\min}\delta^{2}}italic_H ≥ divide start_ARG 50 end_ARG start_ARG italic_π ( italic_s ) ( 1 - italic_π ( italic_s ) ) italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 8 end_ARG start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG)
=πmin​δ24.\displaystyle=\frac{\pi_{\min}\delta^{2}}{4}.= divide start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 4 end_ARG .

Using Lemma B.5, we then have

ℙ​(|π​(s)−N^​(s)H|>32​π​(s)​(1−π​(s))H​γps​log⁡8πmin​δ2)≤δ2.{\mathbb{P}}\left(\left|\pi(s)-\frac{\widehat{N}(s)}{H}\right|>\sqrt{\frac{32\pi(s)(1-\pi(s))}{H\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}\log\frac{8}{\pi_{\min}\delta^{2}}}\right)\leq\frac{\delta}{2}.blackboard_P ( | italic_π ( italic_s ) - divide start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_H end_ARG | > square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG 32 italic_π ( italic_s ) ( 1 - italic_π ( italic_s ) ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_H italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 8 end_ARG start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG ) ≤ divide start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG . (27)

Combining everything. By union bound, we have that with probability at least 1−δ1-\delta1 - italic_δ,
