∥π(f​(t))​(s)p(f​(t))(⋅|s)−1H​N^t​(s)N^t(s,⋅)∥2\displaystyle\left\lVert\sqrt{\pi^{(f(t))}(s)}p^{(f(t))}(\cdot|s)-\frac{1}{\sqrt{H\widehat{N}_{t}(s)}}\widehat{N}_{t}(s,\cdot)\right\rVert_{2}∥ square-root start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ( italic_t ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) end_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ( italic_t ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ⋅ | italic_s ) - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_H over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s ) end_ARG end_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , ⋅ ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
≤2H​log⁡8​(H​π​(s)+1)πmin​δ2+32​(1−π​(s))H​γps​log⁡8πmin​δ2\displaystyle\leq\sqrt{\frac{2}{H}\log\frac{8(H\pi(s)+1)}{\pi_{\min}\delta^{2}}}+\sqrt{\frac{32(1-\pi(s))}{H\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}\log\frac{8}{\pi_{\min}\delta^{2}}}≤ square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_H end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 8 ( italic_H italic_π ( italic_s ) + 1 ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG + square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG 32 ( 1 - italic_π ( italic_s ) ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_H italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 8 end_ARG start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG
≤4​2H​γps​log⁡8​(H​π​(s)+1)πmin​δ2.\displaystyle\leq 4\sqrt{\frac{2}{H\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}\log\frac{8(H\pi(s)+1)}{\pi_{\min}\delta^{2}}}.≤ 4 square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_H italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 8 ( italic_H italic_π ( italic_s ) + 1 ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG . (28)

∎

B.2 Proof of Lemma B.2

Here, we are largely inspired by the proof strategies of Yun and Proutière [2014a, Appendix C] and Yun and Proutière [2016, Appendix C.2].

We start by defining the following sets:

ℐk\displaystyle{\mathcal{I}}_{k}caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT :={t∈f−1(k):∥𝒀^t,:−𝑾t,:∥22≤14(r^)2logT​Hδ},k∈[K]\displaystyle\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=\left\{t\in f^{-1}(k)\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-{\bm{W}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}^{2}\leq\frac{1}{4}(\widehat{r})^{2}\log\frac{TH}{\delta}\right\},\quad k\in[K]: = { italic_t ∈ italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) : ∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 4 end_ARG ( over^ start_ARG italic_r end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log divide start_ARG italic_T italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG } , italic_k ∈ [ italic_K ] (29)
𝒪\displaystyle{\mathcal{O}}caligraphic_O :={t∈[T]:mint′∈[T]∥𝒀^t,:−𝑾t′,:∥22≥4(r^)2logT​Hδ}.\displaystyle\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=\left\{t\in[T]\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}\min_{t^{\prime}\in[T]}\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-{\bm{W}}_{t^{\prime},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}^{2}\geq 4(\widehat{r})^{2}\log\frac{TH}{\delta}\right\}.: = { italic_t ∈ [ italic_T ] : roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ [ italic_T ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≥ 4 ( over^ start_ARG italic_r end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log divide start_ARG italic_T italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG } . (30)

Intuitively, ℐk{\mathcal{I}}_{k}caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is the subset of trajectories of f−1​(k)f^{-1}(k)italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) that will be classified accurately (with high probability), and 𝒪{\mathcal{O}}caligraphic_O is the set of trajectories that are clustered at the end (i.e., lines 12-13).

Then the following properties hold:

  • (i)

    (⋃k=1Kℐk)∩𝒬t=∅\left(\bigcup_{k=1}^{K}{\mathcal{I}}_{k}\right)\cap{\mathcal{Q}}_{t}=\emptyset( ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∩ caligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ∅ for any t∈𝒪t\in{\mathcal{O}}italic_t ∈ caligraphic_O. This is because for any t′∈ℐkt^{\prime}\in{\mathcal{I}}_{k}italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT,

    ‖𝒀^t,:−(𝒀^)t′,:‖22\displaystyle\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-(\widehat{{\bm{Y}}})_{t^{\prime},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}^{2}∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - ( over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≥12​‖𝒀^t,:−𝑾t,:‖22−‖(𝒀^)t′,:−𝑾t,:‖22\displaystyle\geq\frac{1}{2}\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-{\bm{W}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}^{2}-\left\lVert(\widehat{{\bm{Y}}})_{t^{\prime},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-{\bm{W}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}^{2}≥ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - ∥ ( over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ((a+b)2≤2​(a2+b2)(a+b)^{2}\leq 2(a^{2}+b^{2})( italic_a + italic_b ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ 2 ( italic_a start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ))
    ≥2​(r^)2​log⁡T​Hδ−14​(r^)2​log⁡T​Hδ\displaystyle\geq 2(\widehat{r})^{2}\log\frac{TH}{\delta}-\frac{1}{4}(\widehat{r})^{2}\log\frac{TH}{\delta}≥ 2 ( over^ start_ARG italic_r end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log divide start_ARG italic_T italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 4 end_ARG ( over^ start_ARG italic_r end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log divide start_ARG italic_T italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG (Definition of 𝒪{\mathcal{O}}caligraphic_O and ℐk{\mathcal{I}}_{k}caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT)
    =74​(r^)2​log⁡T​Hδ≥(r^)2​log⁡T​Hδ,\displaystyle=\frac{7}{4}(\widehat{r})^{2}\log\frac{TH}{\delta}\geq(\widehat{r})^{2}\log\frac{TH}{\delta},= divide start_ARG 7 end_ARG start_ARG 4 end_ARG ( over^ start_ARG italic_r end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log divide start_ARG italic_T italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG ≥ ( over^ start_ARG italic_r end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log divide start_ARG italic_T italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG ,

    i.e., t′∈𝒬t⇒t′∉⋃k=1Ksℐkt^{\prime}\in{\mathcal{Q}}_{t}\Rightarrow t^{\prime}\not\in\bigcup_{k=1}^{K_{s}}{\mathcal{I}}_{k}italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⇒ italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∉ ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

  • (ii)

    |[T]∖∪k=1Kℐk|≤R​Tlog⁡T​Hδ\left|[T]\setminus\cup_{k=1}^{K}{\mathcal{I}}_{k}\right|\leq\frac{RT}{\log\frac{TH}{\delta}}| [ italic_T ] ∖ ∪ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | ≤ divide start_ARG italic_R italic_T end_ARG start_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_T italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG end_ARG.     |[T]∖∪k=1Kℐk|≤‖𝒀^−𝑾‖F2mint∈[T]∖⁣∪k=1Kℐk⁡‖𝒀^t,:−𝑾t,:‖22≤8​R​T​(r^)214​(r^)2​log⁡T​Hδ=32​R​Tlog⁡T​Hδ\left|[T]\setminus\cup_{k=1}^{K}{\mathcal{I}}_{k}\right|\leq\frac{\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}-{\bm{W}}\right\rVert_{F}^{2}}{\min_{t\in[T]\setminus\cup_{k=1}^{K}{\mathcal{I}}_{k}}\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-{\bm{W}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}^{2}}\leq\frac{8RT(\widehat{r})^{2}}{\frac{1}{4}(\widehat{r})^{2}\log\frac{TH}{\delta}}=\frac{32RT}{\log\frac{TH}{\delta}}| [ italic_T ] ∖ ∪ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | ≤ divide start_ARG ∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG - bold_italic_W ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t ∈ [ italic_T ] ∖ ∪ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ≤ divide start_ARG 8 italic_R italic_T ( over^ start_ARG italic_r end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 4 end_ARG ( over^ start_ARG italic_r end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log divide start_ARG italic_T italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG end_ARG = divide start_ARG 32 italic_R italic_T end_ARG start_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_T italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG end_ARG
  • (iii)

    ℐk⊆𝒬t{\mathcal{I}}_{k}\subseteq{\mathcal{Q}}_{t}caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⊆ caligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for any t∈ℐkt\in{\mathcal{I}}_{k}italic_t ∈ caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. This is because for any t,t′∈ℐkt,t^{\prime}\in{\mathcal{I}}_{k}italic_t , italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT,

    ‖𝒀^t′,:−𝒀^t,:‖22\displaystyle\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t^{\prime},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}^{2}∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤2​‖𝒀^t′,:−𝑾t′,:‖22+2​‖𝒀^t,:−𝑾t,:‖22≤(r^)2​log⁡T​Hδ\displaystyle\leq 2\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t^{\prime},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-{\bm{W}}_{t^{\prime},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}^{2}+2\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-{\bm{W}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}^{2}\leq(\widehat{r})^{2}\log\frac{TH}{\delta}≤ 2 ∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 2 ∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ ( over^ start_ARG italic_r end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log divide start_ARG italic_T italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG
  • (iv)

    If 𝒬t∩ℐk≠∅{\mathcal{Q}}_{t}\cap{\mathcal{I}}_{k}\neq\emptysetcaligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∩ caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≠ ∅, then 𝒬t∩⋃k′≠kℐk=∅{\mathcal{Q}}_{t}\cap\bigcup_{k^{\prime}\neq k}{\mathcal{I}}_{k}=\emptysetcaligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∩ ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≠ italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ∅. We show this via reductio ad absurdum. Suppose there exists k≠k′k\neq k^{\prime}italic_k ≠ italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT such that 𝒬t∩ℐk≠∅{\mathcal{Q}}_{t}\cap{\mathcal{I}}_{k}\neq\emptysetcaligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∩ caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≠ ∅ and 𝒬t∩ℐk′≠∅{\mathcal{Q}}_{t}\cap{\mathcal{I}}_{k^{\prime}}\neq\emptysetcaligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∩ caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≠ ∅. Let tk∈𝒬t∩ℐkt_{k}\in{\mathcal{Q}}_{t}\cap{\mathcal{I}}_{k}italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∩ caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and tk′∈𝒬t∩ℐk′t_{k^{\prime}}\in{\mathcal{Q}}_{t}\cap{\mathcal{I}}_{k^{\prime}}italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∩ caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Then, by definition of 𝒬t{\mathcal{Q}}_{t}caligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT,

    r^​log⁡T​Hδ\displaystyle\widehat{r}\sqrt{\log\frac{TH}{\delta}}over^ start_ARG italic_r end_ARG square-root start_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_T italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG end_ARG ≥‖𝒀^tk,:−𝒀^tk′,:‖2\displaystyle\geq\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t_{k},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t_{k^{\prime}},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}≥ ∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
    ≥‖𝑾tk,:−𝑾tk′,:‖2−‖𝒀^tk,:−𝑾tk,:‖2−‖𝒀^tk′,:−𝑾tk′,:‖2\displaystyle\geq\left\lVert{\bm{W}}_{t_{k},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-{\bm{W}}_{t_{k^{\prime}},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}-\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t_{k},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-{\bm{W}}_{t_{k},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}-\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t_{k^{\prime}},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-{\bm{W}}_{t_{k^{\prime}},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}≥ ∥ bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - ∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - ∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
    ≥Δ𝑾−r^​log⁡T​Hδ.\displaystyle\geq\Delta_{\bm{W}}-\widehat{r}\sqrt{\log\frac{TH}{\delta}}.≥ roman_Δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_W end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over^ start_ARG italic_r end_ARG square-root start_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_T italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG end_ARG .

    Recalling the definition of r^\widehat{r}over^ start_ARG italic_r end_ARG, one can easily check that if H≥28​SΔ𝑾2​γps​log⁡Hδ​log⁡T​HδH\geq 2^{8}\frac{S}{\Delta_{\bm{W}}^{2}\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}\log\frac{H}{\delta}\log\frac{TH}{\delta}italic_H ≥ 2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 8 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_S end_ARG start_ARG roman_Δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_W end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_T italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG, above cannot be true, a contradiction.

Claim B.1.

K^=K\widehat{K}=Kover^ start_ARG italic_K end_ARG = italic_K.

Proof.

WLOG, assume that |ℐ1|≥|ℐ2|≥⋯​|ℐK||{\mathcal{I}}_{1}|\geq|{\mathcal{I}}_{2}|\geq\cdots|{\mathcal{I}}_{K}|| caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | ≥ | caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | ≥ ⋯ | caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT |.

We first show that for each 1≤k≤K1\leq k\leq K1 ≤ italic_k ≤ italic_K,

∃tk⋆∈⋃k′∈[K]ℐk′∖⋃ℓ=1k−1𝒮ℓs.t.|𝒬tk⋆∖⋃ℓ=0k−1𝒮ℓ|≥|ℐk|.\exists t_{k}^{\star}\in\bigcup_{k^{\prime}\in[K]}{\mathcal{I}}_{k^{\prime}}\setminus\bigcup_{\ell=1}^{k-1}{\mathcal{S}}_{\ell}\quad\text{s.t.}\quad\left|{\mathcal{Q}}_{t_{k}^{\star}}\setminus\bigcup_{\ell=0}^{k-1}{\mathcal{S}}_{\ell}\right|\geq|{\mathcal{I}}_{k}|.∃ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ [ italic_K ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∖ ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT s.t. | caligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∖ ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | ≥ | caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | .

Due to the properties (iii) and (iv), and the greedy nature of lines 7-10, the above is indeed true.

Let {t1⋆,⋯,tK⋆}\{t_{1}^{\star},\cdots,t_{K}^{\star}\}{ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } be the selected “centers” with ℐk⊆𝒬tk⋆{\mathcal{I}}_{k}\subseteq{\mathcal{Q}}_{t_{k}^{\star}}caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⊆ caligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Now, we show that after kkitalic_k has reached K+1K+1italic_K + 1 in line 10, the while loop terminates. By property (ii), the number of remaining trajectories is

|[T]∖⋃k∈[K]𝒬tk⋆|≤|[T]∖⋃k∈[K]ℐk|​≤(i​i)​32​R​Tlog⁡T​Hδ,\left|[T]\setminus\bigcup_{k\in[K]}{\mathcal{Q}}_{t_{k}^{\star}}\right|\leq\left|[T]\setminus\bigcup_{k\in[K]}{\mathcal{I}}_{k}\right|\overset{(ii)}{\leq}\frac{32RT}{\log\frac{TH}{\delta}},| [ italic_T ] ∖ ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k ∈ [ italic_K ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | ≤ | [ italic_T ] ∖ ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k ∈ [ italic_K ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_OVERACCENT ( italic_i italic_i ) end_OVERACCENT start_ARG ≤ end_ARG divide start_ARG 32 italic_R italic_T end_ARG start_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_T italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG end_ARG ,

which is precisely the termination criterion at line 7. ∎

Thus, if a trajectory ttitalic_t is misclassified in the sense that it gets assigned to tk′⋆t_{k^{\prime}}^{\star}italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT instead of tk⋆t_{k}^{\star}italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, then it must be that ‖𝒀^t,:−𝒀^tk⋆‖2>‖𝒀^t,:−𝒀^tk′⋆‖2.\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t_{k}^{\star}}\right\rVert_{2}>\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t_{k^{\prime}}^{\star}}\right\rVert_{2}.∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > ∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . By the triangle inequality, this then implies that

‖𝒀^t,:−𝑾t,:‖2+‖𝒀^tk⋆,:−𝑾tk⋆,:‖2+‖𝑾t,:−𝑾tk⋆,:‖20\displaystyle\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-{\bm{W}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}+\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t_{k}^{\star},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-{\bm{W}}_{t_{k}^{\star},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}+\cancelto{0}{\left\lVert{\bm{W}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-{\bm{W}}_{t_{k}^{\star},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}}∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + ∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + SUPERSCRIPTOP cancel ∥ bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0
≥‖𝒀^t,:−𝒀^tk⋆,:‖2\displaystyle\geq\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t_{k}^{\star},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}≥ ∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
>‖𝒀^t,:−𝒀^tk′⋆,:‖2\displaystyle>\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t_{k^{\prime}}^{\star},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}> ∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
>‖𝑾t,:−𝑾tk′⋆,:‖2−‖𝒀^t,:−𝑾t,:‖2−‖𝒀^tk′⋆,:−𝑾tk′⋆,:‖2,\displaystyle>\left\lVert{\bm{W}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-{\bm{W}}_{t_{k^{\prime}}^{\star},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}-\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-{\bm{W}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}-\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t_{k^{\prime}}^{\star},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-{\bm{W}}_{t_{k^{\prime}}^{\star},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2},> ∥ bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - ∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - ∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ,

i.e.,

‖𝒀^t,:−𝑾t‖2\displaystyle\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-{\bm{W}}_{t}\right\rVert_{2}∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT >12​(‖𝑾t,:−𝑾tk′⋆,:‖2−‖𝒀^tk′⋆,:−𝑾tk⋆,:‖2−‖𝒀^tk⋆,:−𝑾tk′⋆,:‖2)\displaystyle>\frac{1}{2}\left(\left\lVert{\bm{W}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-{\bm{W}}_{t_{k^{\prime}}^{\star},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}-\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t_{k^{\prime}}^{\star},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-{\bm{W}}_{t_{k}^{\star},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}-\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t_{k}^{\star},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-{\bm{W}}_{t_{k^{\prime}}^{\star},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}\right)> divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ( ∥ bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - ∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - ∥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )
≥12​(Δ𝑾−12​Δ𝑾)\displaystyle\geq\frac{1}{2}\left(\Delta_{\bm{W}}-\frac{1}{2}\Delta_{\bm{W}}\right)≥ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ( roman_Δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_W end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG roman_Δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_W end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (tk⋆,tk′⋆∈⋃k=1Kℐkt_{k}^{\star},t_{k^{\prime}}^{\star}\in\bigcup_{k=1}^{K}{\mathcal{I}}_{k}italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, see the proof of property (iv))
=14​Δ𝑾.\displaystyle=\frac{1}{4}\Delta_{\bm{W}}.= divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 4 end_ARG roman_Δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_W end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

∎

B.3 Proof of Lemma B.3

As the exact constants for the ℓ2\ell_{2}roman_ℓ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-distance concentration have been left to exercise in Canonne [2020], we provide the complete proof here.

First, we have that

𝔼​[‖p^N−p‖22]\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[\left\lVert\hat{p}_{N}-p\right\rVert_{2}^{2}\right]blackboard_E [ ∥ over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_p ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] =∑s∈𝒮𝔼​[(p^N​(s)−p​(s))2]\displaystyle=\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}}\mathbb{E}\left[(\hat{p}_{N}(s)-p(s))^{2}\right]= ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∈ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E [ ( over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s ) - italic_p ( italic_s ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]
=1N2​∑s∈𝒮Var​[Bin​(N,p​(s))]\displaystyle=\frac{1}{N^{2}}\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}}\mathrm{Var}[\mathrm{Bin}(N,p(s))]= divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∈ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Var [ roman_Bin ( italic_N , italic_p ( italic_s ) ) ] (N​p^N​(s)∼Bin​(N,p​(s))N\hat{p}_{N}(s)\sim\mathrm{Bin}(N,p(s))italic_N over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s ) ∼ roman_Bin ( italic_N , italic_p ( italic_s ) ))
=1N​∑s∈𝒮p​(s)​(1−p​(s))\displaystyle=\frac{1}{N}\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}}p(s)(1-p(s))= divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∈ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s ) ( 1 - italic_p ( italic_s ) )
=1N​(1−∑s∈𝒮p​(s)2)\displaystyle=\frac{1}{N}\left(1-\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}}p(s)^{2}\right)= divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( 1 - ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∈ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )
≤1N​(1−1S),\displaystyle\leq\frac{1}{N}\left(1-\frac{1}{S}\right),≤ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( 1 - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_S end_ARG ) , (Cauchy-Schwartz inequality)

i.e., with N≥4ε2​(1−1S)N\geq\frac{4}{\varepsilon^{2}}\left(1-\frac{1}{S}\right)italic_N ≥ divide start_ARG 4 end_ARG start_ARG italic_ε start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ( 1 - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_S end_ARG ),

𝔼​[‖p^N−p‖2]​≤(∗)​𝔼​[‖p^N−p‖22]≤ε2,\mathbb{E}\left[\left\lVert\hat{p}_{N}-p\right\rVert_{2}\right]\overset{(*)}{\leq}\sqrt{\mathbb{E}\left[\left\lVert\hat{p}_{N}-p\right\rVert_{2}^{2}\right]}\leq\frac{\varepsilon}{2},blackboard_E [ ∥ over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_p ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] start_OVERACCENT ( ∗ ) end_OVERACCENT start_ARG ≤ end_ARG square-root start_ARG blackboard_E [ ∥ over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_p ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] end_ARG ≤ divide start_ARG italic_ε end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ,

where (∗)(*)( ∗ ) follows from Jensen’s inequality.

We now utilize the McDiarmid’s inequality [McDiarmid, 1989] to turn this into a tight high-probability guarantee. For 𝒔N=(s1,⋯,sN){\bm{s}}_{N}=(s_{1},\cdots,s_{N})bold_italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋯ , italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), let us define

f(𝒔N):=∥p^N−p∥2=∑i=1N(p^N​(si)−p​(si))2.\displaystyle f({\bm{s}}_{N})\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=\|\hat{p}_{N}-p\|_{2}=\sqrt{\sum_{i=1}^{N}(\hat{p}_{N}(s_{i})-p(s_{i}))^{2}}.italic_f ( bold_italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) : = ∥ over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_p ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = square-root start_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG .

Now, let 𝒔¬i=(s1,…,si−1,si′,si+1,…,sN){\bm{s}}^{\neg i}=(s_{1},\dots,s_{i-1},s_{i}^{\prime},s_{i+1},\dots,s_{N})bold_italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ¬ italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) for si′∈{0,1}s_{i}^{\prime}\in\{0,1\}italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ { 0 , 1 } and p^N¬i\hat{p}_{N}^{\neg i}over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ¬ italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT be the empirical distribution using 𝒙¬i{\bm{x}}^{\neg i}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ¬ italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Observe that

|f​(𝒔)−f​(𝒔¬i)|\displaystyle|f({\bm{s}})-f({\bm{s}}^{\neg i})|| italic_f ( bold_italic_s ) - italic_f ( bold_italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ¬ italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) | =|‖p^N−p‖2−‖p^N¬i−p‖2|\displaystyle=\left|\|\hat{p}_{N}-p\|_{2}-\|\hat{p}_{N}^{\neg i}-p\|_{2}\right|= | ∥ over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_p ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - ∥ over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ¬ italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_p ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT |
≤‖p^N−p^N¬i‖2\displaystyle\leq\|\hat{p}_{N}-\hat{p}_{N}^{\neg i}\|_{2}≤ ∥ over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ¬ italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (Triangle inequality)
=1N​|si−si′|≤1N.\displaystyle=\frac{1}{N}|s_{i}-s_{i}^{\prime}|\leq\frac{1}{N}.= divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG | italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | ≤ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG .

Thus, ffitalic_f satisfies the bounded difference property with ci=1/Nc_{i}=1/Nitalic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1 / italic_N.

Combining everything, we have that

ℙ​(‖p^N−p‖2≥ε)\displaystyle{\mathbb{P}}\left(\left\lVert\hat{p}_{N}-p\right\rVert_{2}\geq\varepsilon\right)blackboard_P ( ∥ over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_p ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≥ italic_ε ) ≤ℙ​(‖p^N−p‖2−𝔼​[‖p^N−p‖2]≥ε2)\displaystyle\leq{\mathbb{P}}\left(\left\lVert\hat{p}_{N}-p\right\rVert_{2}-\mathbb{E}[\left\lVert\hat{p}_{N}-p\right\rVert_{2}]\geq\frac{\varepsilon}{2}\right)≤ blackboard_P ( ∥ over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_p ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - blackboard_E [ ∥ over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_p ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] ≥ divide start_ARG italic_ε end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ) (with N≥4ε2​(1−1S)N\geq\frac{4}{\varepsilon^{2}}\left(1-\frac{1}{S}\right)italic_N ≥ divide start_ARG 4 end_ARG start_ARG italic_ε start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ( 1 - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_S end_ARG ))
≤exp⁡(−2​(ε2)2N​(1N)2)\displaystyle\leq\exp\left(-\frac{2\left(\frac{\varepsilon}{2}\right)^{2}}{N\left(\frac{1}{N}\right)^{2}}\right)≤ roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG 2 ( divide start_ARG italic_ε end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_N ( divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG )
=exp⁡(−ε2​N2).\displaystyle=\exp\left(-\frac{\varepsilon^{2}N}{2}\right).= roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG italic_ε start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ) .

∎

Appendix C Proof of Theorem 4.2 – Likelihood Improvement

The proof largely follows the recipe of likelihood improvement for SBM clustering [Yun and Proutière, 2014b, a], which dates back to the seminal works of Abbe [2018], Amini et al. [2013] and recently extended to other variants such as labeled SBM [Yun and Proutière, 2016] and block Markov chains [Jedra et al., 2023, Sanders et al., 2020].

Let ℋ⊆[T]{\mathcal{H}}\subseteq[T]caligraphic_H ⊆ [ italic_T ] be the maximum subset satisfying the following: whenever t∈f−1​(k)∩ℋt\in f^{-1}(k)\cap{\mathcal{H}}italic_t ∈ italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) ∩ caligraphic_H,

∑s,s′∈𝒮N^t​(s,s′)​log⁡p(k)​(s′|s)p(k′)​(s′|s)≥C​(H−1)​𝒟π,∀k′≠k.\sum_{s,s^{\prime}\in{\mathcal{S}}}\widehat{N}_{t}(s,s^{\prime})\log\frac{p^{(k)}(s^{\prime}|s)}{p^{(k^{\prime})}(s^{\prime}|s)}\geq C(H-1){\mathcal{D}}_{\pi},\quad\forall k^{\prime}\neq k.∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) roman_log divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG ≥ italic_C ( italic_H - 1 ) caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ∀ italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≠ italic_k . (31)

The first proposition bounds |ℋ∁||{\mathcal{H}}^{\complement}|| caligraphic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∁ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | in-expectation, which then leads to a w.h.p. guarantee via Markov’s inequality:

Proposition C.1.

Suppose that H≳ηp2γps​𝒟π​log⁡1πminH\gtrsim\frac{\eta_{p}^{2}}{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}{\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}}\log\frac{1}{\pi_{\min}}italic_H ≳ divide start_ARG italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG. With C=12C=\frac{1}{2}italic_C = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG, We have that

𝔼​[|ℋ∁|]≤T​(K−1)​exp⁡(−γps​(H−1)​𝒟π128​(4​ηp2+5​log⁡ηp)).\mathbb{E}[|{\mathcal{H}}^{\complement}|]\leq T(K-1)\exp\left(-\frac{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}(H-1){\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}}{128(4\eta_{p}^{2}+5\log\eta_{p})}\right).blackboard_E [ | caligraphic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∁ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | ] ≤ italic_T ( italic_K - 1 ) roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H - 1 ) caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 128 ( 4 italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 5 roman_log italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG ) . (32)

Thus, by Markov’s inequality, we have that

ℙ​(|ℋ∁|≥T​exp⁡(−γps​(H−1)​𝒟π256​(4​ηp2+5​log⁡ηp)))≤K​exp⁡(−γps​(H−1)​𝒟π256​(4​ηp2+5​log⁡ηp)).{\mathbb{P}}\left(|{\mathcal{H}}^{\complement}|\geq T\exp\left(-\frac{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}(H-1){\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}}{256(4\eta_{p}^{2}+5\log\eta_{p})}\right)\right)\leq K\exp\left(-\frac{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}(H-1){\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}}{256(4\eta_{p}^{2}+5\log\eta_{p})}\right).blackboard_P ( | caligraphic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∁ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | ≥ italic_T roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H - 1 ) caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 256 ( 4 italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 5 roman_log italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG ) ) ≤ italic_K roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H - 1 ) caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 256 ( 4 italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 5 roman_log italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG ) . (33)

We next show that all trajectories in ℋ{\mathcal{H}}caligraphic_H are correctly classified with high probability:

Proposition C.2.

Suppose that the following requirements on HHitalic_H and TTitalic_T hold:

H≳1γps​(S2​log⁡T∨1vmin​log⁡T​Hπmin∨ηp​ηπ​R​Sαmin​H​Δ𝑾2​𝒟π​log⁡(T​H)),T​H≳(S​log⁡T)2γps​αmin​𝒟π2.H\gtrsim\frac{1}{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}\left(S^{2}\log T\vee\frac{1}{v_{\min}}\log\frac{TH}{\pi_{\min}}\vee\frac{\eta_{p}\eta_{\pi}RS}{\alpha_{\min}H\Delta_{\bm{W}}^{2}{\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}}\log(TH)\right),\ TH\gtrsim\frac{(S\log T)^{2}}{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}\alpha_{\min}{\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}^{2}}.italic_H ≳ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ( italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log italic_T ∨ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_T italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ∨ divide start_ARG italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R italic_S end_ARG start_ARG italic_α start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H roman_Δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_W end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log ( italic_T italic_H ) ) , italic_T italic_H ≳ divide start_ARG ( italic_S roman_log italic_T ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_α start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG . (34)

Then, all trajectories in ℋ{\mathcal{H}}caligraphic_H are correctly classified with probability at least 1−1πmin​T−1T​H1-\frac{1}{\sqrt{\pi_{\min}}T}-\frac{1}{TH}1 - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG italic_T end_ARG - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_T italic_H end_ARG.

Note that the probability in Eqn. (33) goes to 0 as T→∞T\rightarrow\inftyitalic_T → ∞. from our requirement that H≳log⁡TH\gtrsim\log Titalic_H ≳ roman_log italic_T (ignoring other factors). Then, the proof concludes by taking the worst-case, namely, that all the trajectories in ℋ∁{\mathcal{H}}^{\complement}caligraphic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∁ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT are misclassified, and applying a union bound. ∎

C.1 Proof of Proposition C.1

First note that

𝔼​[|ℋ∁|]\displaystyle\mathbb{E}[|{\mathcal{H}}^{\complement}|]blackboard_E [ | caligraphic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∁ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | ] =∑t∈[T]ℙ​(∃k′≠f​(t)∈[K]​ s.t. ​∑s,s′∈𝒮N^t​(s,s′)​log⁡p(f​(t))​(s′|s)p(k′)​(s′|s)<C​(H−1)​𝒟π)\displaystyle=\sum_{t\in[T]}{\mathbb{P}}\left(\exists k^{\prime}\neq f(t)\in[K]\text{ s.t. }\sum_{s,s^{\prime}\in{\mathcal{S}}}\widehat{N}_{t}(s,s^{\prime})\log\frac{p^{(f(t))}(s^{\prime}|s)}{p^{(k^{\prime})}(s^{\prime}|s)}<C(H-1){\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}\right)= ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t ∈ [ italic_T ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P ( ∃ italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≠ italic_f ( italic_t ) ∈ [ italic_K ] s.t. ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) roman_log divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ( italic_t ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG < italic_C ( italic_H - 1 ) caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

≤(K−1)​∑t∈[T]maxk′≠f​(t)∈[K]⁡ℙ​(∑s,s′∈𝒮N^t​(s,s′)​log⁡p(f​(t))​(s′|s)p(k′)​(s′|s)<C​(H−1)​𝒟π​(t;k′)),\displaystyle\leq(K-1)\sum_{t\in[T]}\max_{k^{\prime}\neq f(t)\in[K]}{\mathbb{P}}\left(\sum_{s,s^{\prime}\in{\mathcal{S}}}\widehat{N}_{t}(s,s^{\prime})\log\frac{p^{(f(t))}(s^{\prime}|s)}{p^{(k^{\prime})}(s^{\prime}|s)}<C(H-1){\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}(t;k^{\prime})\right),≤ ( italic_K - 1 ) ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t ∈ [ italic_T ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≠ italic_f ( italic_t ) ∈ [ italic_K ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P ( ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) roman_log divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ( italic_t ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG < italic_C ( italic_H - 1 ) caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ; italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) ,

where we denote 𝒟π(t;k′):=𝒟π(f​(t),k′)=∑s∈𝒮π(f​(t))(s)𝖪𝖫(p(f​(t))(⋅|s),p(k′)(⋅|s)){\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}(t;k^{\prime})\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}={\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}^{(f(t),k^{\prime})}=\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}}\pi^{(f(t))}(s)\operatorname{{\mathsf{KL}}}(p^{(f(t))}(\cdot|s),p^{(k^{\prime})}(\cdot|s))caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ; italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) : = caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ( italic_t ) , italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∈ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ( italic_t ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) sansserif_KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ( italic_t ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ⋅ | italic_s ) , italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ⋅ | italic_s ) ).

As done in Sanders et al. [2020], Jedra et al. [2023], define an “augmented” Markov chain, Xt,h:=(st,h,st,h+1)X_{t,h}\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=(s_{t,h},s_{t,h+1})italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : = ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). For notational simplicity, let us denote p:=p(f​(t))p\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=p^{(f(t))}italic_p : = italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ( italic_t ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and π=π(f​(t))\pi=\pi^{(f(t))}italic_π = italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ( italic_t ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

This is a Markov chain on 𝒮×𝒮{\mathcal{S}}\times{\mathcal{S}}caligraphic_S × caligraphic_S, with transition probability kernel p~​(st,h+1,st,h+2|st,h,st,h+1)=p​(st,h+2|st,h+1)\tilde{p}(s_{t,h+1},s_{t,h+2}|s_{t,h},s_{t,h+1})=p(s_{t,h+2}|s_{t,h+1})over~ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h + 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h + 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and stationary distribution π~​(s,s′)=π​(s)​p​(s′|s)\tilde{\pi}(s,s^{\prime})=\pi(s)p(s^{\prime}|s)over~ start_ARG italic_π end_ARG ( italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = italic_π ( italic_s ) italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ). We have the following property that we provide the proof at the end:

Lemma C.1.

The pseudo-spectral gap of Xt,hX_{t,h}italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is also γ\gammaitalic_γ.

Now define a function ϕk′:𝒮×𝒮→ℝ\phi_{k^{\prime}}\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}{\mathcal{S}}\times{\mathcal{S}}\rightarrow{\mathbb{R}}italic_ϕ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : caligraphic_S × caligraphic_S → blackboard_R as

ϕk′(Xt,h):=∑s,s′∈𝒮𝟙[st,h=s,st,h+1=s′]logp​(s′|s)p(k′)​(s′|s)=logp​(st,h+1|st,h)p(k′)​(st,h+1|st,h).\phi_{k^{\prime}}(X_{t,h})\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=\sum_{s,s^{\prime}\in{\mathcal{S}}}\mathds{1}[s_{t,h}=s,s_{t,h+1}=s^{\prime}]\log\frac{p(s^{\prime}|s)}{p^{(k^{\prime})}(s^{\prime}|s)}=\log\frac{p(s_{t,h+1}|s_{t,h})}{p^{(k^{\prime})}(s_{t,h+1}|s_{t,h})}.italic_ϕ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) : = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_1 [ italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] roman_log divide start_ARG italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG = roman_log divide start_ARG italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG . (35)

To apply the above concentration, we compute the necessary quantities. First, by Assumption 2, we have that for any (s,s′)∈𝒮×𝒮(s,s^{\prime})\in{\mathcal{S}}\times{\mathcal{S}}( italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ∈ caligraphic_S × caligraphic_S,

|ϕ(s,s′)−𝔼π[ϕ]|=|logp​(s′|s)p(k′)​(s′|s)−∑s,s′∈𝒮π(s)p(s′|s)logp​(s′|s)p(k′)​(s′|s)|≤2logηp.|\phi(s,s^{\prime})-\mathbb{E}_{\pi}[\phi]|=\left|\log\frac{p(s^{\prime}|s)}{p^{(k^{\prime})}(s^{\prime}|s)}-\sum_{s,s^{\prime}\in{\mathcal{S}}}\pi(s)p(s^{\prime}|s)\log\frac{p(s^{\prime}|s)}{p^{(k^{\prime})}(s^{\prime}|s)}\right|\leq 2\log\eta_{p}.| italic_ϕ ( italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_ϕ ] | = | roman_log divide start_ARG italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG - ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_s ) italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) roman_log divide start_ARG italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG | ≤ 2 roman_log italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Also, note that

Varπ​[ϕ]\displaystyle\mathrm{Var}_{\pi}[\phi]roman_Var start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_ϕ ] ≤𝔼π​[ϕ2]\displaystyle\leq\mathbb{E}_{\pi}[\phi^{2}]≤ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_ϕ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]
=∑s,s′π​(s)​p​(s′|s)​(log⁡p​(s′|s)p(k′)​(s′|s))2\displaystyle=\sum_{s,s^{\prime}}\pi(s)p(s^{\prime}|s)\left(\log\frac{p(s^{\prime}|s)}{p^{(k^{\prime})}(s^{\prime}|s)}\right)^{2}= ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_s ) italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) ( roman_log divide start_ARG italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT
≤2(maxs′∈𝒮p​(s′|s)∨p(k′)​(s′|s)p​(s′|s)∧p(k′)​(s′|s))2∑s∈𝒮π(s)𝖪𝖫(p(⋅|s),p(k′)(⋅|s))\displaystyle\leq 2\left(\max_{s^{\prime}\in{\mathcal{S}}}\frac{p(s^{\prime}|s)\vee p^{(k^{\prime})}(s^{\prime}|s)}{p(s^{\prime}|s)\wedge p^{(k^{\prime})}(s^{\prime}|s)}\right)^{2}\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}}\pi(s)\operatorname{{\mathsf{KL}}}\left(p(\cdot|s),p^{(k^{\prime})}(\cdot|s)\right)≤ 2 ( roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) ∨ italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) ∧ italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∈ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π ( italic_s ) sansserif_KL ( italic_p ( ⋅ | italic_s ) , italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ⋅ | italic_s ) ) (Lemma 19 of SM6.3 of Sanders et al. [2020])
≤2​ηp2​𝒟π​(t;k′).\displaystyle\leq 2\eta_{p}^{2}{\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}(t;k^{\prime}).≤ 2 italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ; italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) . (Assumption 2)

With this, we have that

ℙπ​(∑s,s′∈𝒮N^t​(s,s′)​log⁡p(k)​(s′|s)p(k′)​(s′|s)<C​(H−1)​𝒟π​(t;k′))\displaystyle{\mathbb{P}}_{\pi}\left(\sum_{s,s^{\prime}\in{\mathcal{S}}}\widehat{N}_{t}(s,s^{\prime})\log\frac{p^{(k)}(s^{\prime}|s)}{p^{(k^{\prime})}(s^{\prime}|s)}<C(H-1){\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}(t;k^{\prime})\right)blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) roman_log divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG < italic_C ( italic_H - 1 ) caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ; italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) )
=ℙπ​(∑h=1H−1(ϕk′​(Xt,h)−𝔼​[ϕk′​(Xt,h)])<−(1−C)​(H−1)​𝒟π​(t;k′))\displaystyle={\mathbb{P}}_{\pi}\left(\sum_{h=1}^{H-1}(\phi_{k^{\prime}}(X_{t,h})-\mathbb{E}[\phi_{k^{\prime}}(X_{t,h})])<-(1-C)(H-1){\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}(t;k^{\prime})\right)= blackboard_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_ϕ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - blackboard_E [ italic_ϕ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] ) < - ( 1 - italic_C ) ( italic_H - 1 ) caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ; italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) )
≤exp⁡(−(1−C)2​(H−1)2​(𝒟π​(t;k′))2​γps32​ηp2​(H−1)​𝒟π​(t;k′)+40​(log⁡ηp)​(H−1)​𝒟π​(t;k′))\displaystyle\leq\exp\left(-\frac{(1-C)^{2}(H-1)^{2}({\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}(t;k^{\prime}))^{2}\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}{32\eta_{p}^{2}(H-1){\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}(t;k^{\prime})+40(\log\eta_{p})(H-1){\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}(t;k^{\prime})}\right)≤ roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG ( 1 - italic_C ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_H - 1 ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ; italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 32 italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_H - 1 ) caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ; italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + 40 ( roman_log italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( italic_H - 1 ) caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ; italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG ) (Lemma B.4, Lemma C.1, and H>1γpsH>\frac{1}{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}italic_H > divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG)
≤exp⁡(−(1−C)28​(4​ηp2+5​log⁡ηp)​γps​(H−1)​𝒟π​(t;k′))\displaystyle\leq\exp\left(-\frac{(1-C)^{2}}{8(4\eta_{p}^{2}+5\log\eta_{p})}\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}(H-1){\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}(t;k^{\prime})\right)≤ roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG ( 1 - italic_C ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 8 ( 4 italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 5 roman_log italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H - 1 ) caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ; italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) )

We choose C=12C=\frac{1}{2}italic_C = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG and invoke Lemma B.5, which yields

ℙ​(∑s,s′∈𝒮N^t​(s,s′)​log⁡p(k)​(s′|s)p(k′)​(s′|s)<(H−1)​𝒟π​(t;k′)2)\displaystyle{\mathbb{P}}\left(\sum_{s,s^{\prime}\in{\mathcal{S}}}\widehat{N}_{t}(s,s^{\prime})\log\frac{p^{(k)}(s^{\prime}|s)}{p^{(k^{\prime})}(s^{\prime}|s)}<\frac{(H-1){\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}(t;k^{\prime})}{2}\right)blackboard_P ( ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) roman_log divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG < divide start_ARG ( italic_H - 1 ) caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ; italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG )
≤1πmin​exp⁡(−132​(4​ηp2+5​log⁡ηp)​γps​(H−1)​𝒟π)\displaystyle\leq\sqrt{\frac{1}{\pi_{\min}}\exp\left(-\frac{1}{32(4\eta_{p}^{2}+5\log\eta_{p})}\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}(H-1){\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}\right)}≤ square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 32 ( 4 italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 5 roman_log italic_η start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG italic_γ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H - 1 ) caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_π end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG
